texts.en:
Edra is a young carpenter.  He is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the town of Perquín in the department of Morazán.  

His father taught him about the business, and for the last six years, he has worked as a carpenter.  He works building tables, beds, dressers, toy boxes, and wardrobes.  He doesn't have set work hours.

He currently needs a machine that will help his work, so he is asking for this loan to purchase tools that will improve and speed up his production.

His dream is to own his own home with the help of his workshop, and he hopes to keep earning more income to support his family.

loans.use: Purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
46-year-old Gilda B. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. Gilda is a farmer. She and her husband own and till their own land. They plant rice crops and pineapple. They sell their harvest to the market. Gilda also loves tailoring. She provides general alteration and tailoring services to her neighbors and other people in their community.

Gilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and clothing materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gilda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and clothing materials

loans.name: Santos Pastor

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Pastor M. tiene 52 años de edad y vive en el caserio El Conton, Santos es relojero, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de “ RELOJERIA LASER “ la cual se encuentra ubicada en el mercado San Miguel del Barrio Guanacaste en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, este un lugar muy estratégico ya que pasa una buena cantidad de personas. En su negocio presta los servicios de Reparación y limpieza de relojes, cambio de baterías, arregla tambien cadenas, aritos y pulseras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de: relojes, baterías, brazaletes, vidrios, maquinarias de relojes entre otros.
se aproxima la navidad y muchas personas aprovechan para arregalar sus relojes que estan en mal estado tambien para comprar nuevos relojes.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Pastor M., 52, lives in El Conton.  He is a watch repairman.  His business operates under the name of “RELOJERIA LASER” and is located in the San Miguel market in Tegucigalpa's Guanacaste neighborhood .  This is a very strategic location because many people pass by there.  His business is watch repair, cleaning, battery replacement.  He also repairs chains, earring and bracelets.

He will use the loan to buy watches, batteries, watchbands, watch cover glass, watch works, etc.

Christmas is approaching and many people take advantage of this time to repair their damaged watches as well as to buy new ones.

loans.use: To buy batteries, watch bands, watch cover glass, watch works, new watches.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Carlos; el tiene 35 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como cereales y menestras donde vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cereales y menestras. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar menestras y cereales al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Juan Carlos is 35 years old, married and has three children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling dry products such as cereal and pulses.  He sells his products in Urubamba market from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Through his business, Juan Carlos gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to expand and improve his business selling cereals and pulses.

Juan Carlos is requesting this loan to buy pulses and cereals wholesale.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy pulses and cereals wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five school-age children. He has owned his small grocery store since 2001. He offers food products, dairy products, detergents etc. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products for his shop to increase his products variety, which will satisfy his customer’s needs and therefore his family's profits. In the future, he expects that his business will continue to grow in the coming year. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, storeowners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for his shop

loans.name: Rosa  Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa María; ella tiene 43 años de edad, viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de un hostal ,la socia lleva poco tiempo en este negocio pero le va muy bien , a la vez la socia es profesora del nivel primario en el Colegio Nacional Miguel Grau en Cusco ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07:00 am hasta las 02:00pm , la socia está feliz ya que tiene otro negocio aparte de su trabajo eso le hace sentir bien ya que mediante estos dos trabajos ella saca a su familia adelante  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su hostal como colchones y camas para así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 43, is a member of the ”AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA” (Savings Mean Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a widow and has two children.  She has a boardinghouse.  She’s been in this business a short time but is doing well.  At the same time, she is an elementary school teacher at Cusco’s Colegio Nacional Miguel Grau.  She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 2pm.  She is happy because she has an additional business besides her employment and this makes her feel good because the two jobs allow her to support her family.

She is asking for funding to equip her boardinghouse with mattresses and beds to provide better customer service.

She is happy about the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To equip her boardinghouse with items like mattresses and beds to provide better customer service.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años. Su familia lo conforma su esposo Porfirio, y sus 4 hijos, que son muy unidos; pero solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. Gracias a su constancia y entrega, está exitosa mujer logró adquirir un camión con el que trasporta naranja de la selva central a la capital del país, pero eso no es el único ingreso económico que tiene. También tiene 4 vacas, que proporcionan leche suficiente para la elaboración de queso, que comercializa a los pobladores de su localidad. Pero el trabajo que más le gusta a ella es “la agricultura”, ahí siembra papa y arveja desde hace 20 años, los cuales manda a Lima, por medio de un intermediario, un mayorista que comercializa productos en la capital. Sus planes son sembrar en mayores cantidades, para poder obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una asidua colaboradora. Guillermina, dentro de algunos meses cosechará papa; por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes naturales para que su próxima cosecha sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a hard-working 45 year old woman.  Her family is comprised of her husband, Porfirio, and their four children.  The children are very united, but they only live with three of them.  She lives in her own house, which is located in the rural community of Pongo.  

Thanks to her perseverance and dedication, this successful woman managed to get a truck.  She uses the truck to transport oranges from the central jungle to the capital of the country.  But, this is not the only income that she has.  She also has four cows who give enough milk to make cheese.  She sells the cheese to the people who live in her area.

However, the work that she likes the best is farming.  She has been growing potatoes and peas for 20 years.  She sends these crops to Lima via an intermediary, a wholesaler who sells products in the capital.  Her plans are to grow greater quantities in order to be able to get better earnings.

She belongs to the “Paraíso al Progreso” Communal Bank.  This is her third loan with MFP, where she is a regular collaborator.  

Within a few months, Guillermina will harvest potatoes.  Therefore, she is planning on buying various sacks of natural and chemical fertilizer so that her next harvest is a complete success.

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Mehinno

texts.fr: Monsieur  Mehinno est mariée avec  3 enfants  à charge.  Il  est né  en  1957 à  Glidji.  Il habite quartier Gbényédzi  et fait l’élevage  de porc.  Pour  pouvoir nourrir les porcs,  Il s’approvisionne  à vogan.  Il a commencé son activité  en  2006.  Il sollicite un prêt  pour acheter  4 sacs de soja, 2 sacs de manioc, 2 sacs de maïs et 4 porcins.
texts.en: Mr. Mehinno is married and has three children to support.  He was born in 1957 in Glidji. He lives in the Gbényédzi district and raises pigs. To feed his pigs, he stocks up in Vogan. He started this business in 2006. He is requesting a loan to buy 4 sacks of soybeans, 2 sacks of cassava, 2 sacks of corn, and 4 hogs.

loans.use: Buying soybeans, cassava, and corn

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana R. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 59 years old. Luciana is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Luciana owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, junk foods, and canned goods in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk food. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and junk food for sale in her retail shop

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Amapolas De Puente Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Amapolas de puente" y se ubica en el estado de Morelos en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes  y es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Yesenia Bárcenas Rodríguez es integrante del grupo, tiene 25 años, estudio hasta el 3 año de  secundaria, es casada y tiene  2 hijos, una mujer y un varón, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes negocio que inicio hace 2 años, solicita el préstamo  para  comprar más perfumes para que su negocio crezca, sus clientes se sienten a gusto con ella por la atención que les da y por que les entrega a tiempo sus pedidos, al momento de solicitar el crédito se siente a gusto porque podrá entregar todos sus pedidos que le  solicitaron y con las ganancias comprara material para empezar a construir los cimientos de su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called “Amapolas de Puente” (Puente Poppies) and is located in the Mexican state of Morelos.  It has 9 members and this is their second loan request.

Yesenia Bárcenas Rodríguez, 25, is a group member.  She finished 9th grade, is married and has two children, a boy and a girl.  She sells perfume, a business she started two years ago.  She’s asking for the loan to buy more perfume so that her business will grow and her customers will feel good about the attention she gives them and because she fills their orders on time.

She feels good about the loan because she’ll be able to deliver all her pending orders and will use profits to buy building materials and supplies to lay the foundation and start building her house.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, from the village of Dullan, Aloran, is 53 years old, married, and has three grown children. To make a living, Josephine runs a business venture selling dried fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for 20 years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC, she is requesting her sixth loan of 50000 PHP with which to purchase dried fish to sell. Josephine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
From Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Pal T. is a local rice farmer, and she has been in the farming business for years. She typically generates an income of $1 per day. Her husband earns a profit by driving a plowing machine for his neighbors when they need a machine to plow on their farmland. 

This couple has been married for years and has four children. Two of them are employed as garment workers at the factory and they have formal salaries. 

Pal T. is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling. She and her husband always travel to anywhere by hiring a motor taxi or walking as they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Pal T. has requested a loan in the amount of $600 to be used to buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr: Agée  de 34ans, Mme Ayawovi est veuve et mère de 02 enfants, c’est une  femme dévouée et  pleine de bonne volonté. Elle est revendeuse de charbon (ce produit est  énormément utilisée par les ménages, c est un combustible qui permet la cuisson des aliments donc très demandé par  les femmes en cuisine) et exerce cette activité depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Notsé(une ville située à 100km de la ville de Lomé) et revend à  Anfamé(un quartier de la ville de Lomé) Ce premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter  du charbon pour revendre à la population de Lomé et des environs afin d’avoir de bénéfice pour mieux s’occuper de ses enfants  à qui seule la charge lui revient, pour  accroitre son activité   et pour    plus tard construire sa maison et investir dans une autre activité commerciale génératrice de revenus.
texts.en: Aged 34, Ayawovi is a widow and the mother of 2 children.  She is devoted and always ready to help others. She sells charcoal (this product is  widely used by households, it's a cooking fuel so it is very much in demand by women in the kitchen). She has been involved in this activity for 13 years. She gets her supplies at  Notsé (a town about 100km from the city of Lomé) and resells in Anfamé (a district of the city of Lomé). This first loan will allow her to buy coal to sell to the people of Lomé and  the surrounding area. She will be able to make a profit so she can take better care of the children. She will also be able to increase her level of activity in the business and, later on,  to build a house and invest in another income-producing activity.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman, a married man with three children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. School fees are his greatest monthly expense.

For the past 10 years Athman has operated a freshwater sales business, selling from door to door to his neighbours and passersby. His greatest business challenge is seasonality, but he dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future. Athman decided to work with Yehu because of its good customer relations, and with the Kshs 20,000 loan he will purchase a water pumping machine.

loans.use: to purchase a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José de 49 años,  vive en su casa  propia con su esposa, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos, que pertenece al departamento de la Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y   ganadería.

Desde hace algunos años José se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y maracuya, son productos que puede cosechar semanal y quincenalmente, el mismo que vende en los diferentes mercados de la zona, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor, con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos y poder solventar sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para brindar mantenimiento y comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus cosechas podrá pagar su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  José  es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es sacar adelante su negocio y tener más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and lives together with his wife in his own home, in Olmos district, in Lambayeque department.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

José has been farming for some years.  He owns his own farm land where he sows lemons and passion fruit.  These are products that he can harvest weekly and fortnightly.  He sells them in the different markets in his area, both wholesale and retail, with the goal of increasing his income and covering his household expenses.

José has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can care for his crops and buy fertilizers in order to improve his land.  He will use the profits from the sale of his harvests to repay his loan and improve his quality of life.  José is a responsible and hard-working person and the only thing he wants is to get ahead in his business and enjoy more comforts at home.

loans.use: to care for his crops and buy fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza viven en la comunidad de Puerto Jimenez, una de las zonas mas verdes de Costa Rica.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, y ha sacado a su familia adelante por si sola. Por falta de dinero no ha podido terminar su casita, en este momento solo le falta el piso, y es por eso que hoy ella necesita un préstamo de ₡300 000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de cerámica para ponerle piso a su casa.
Ella es socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal Raíces Capitales, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Esperanza lives in the community of Puerto Jimenez, one of the greenest areas in Costa Rica.  She is a very hard-working woman who has managed to get her family ahead in life on her own.  Through a lack of money, she has not been able to finish her house.  Right now, she is only lacking flooring.  She needs a loan for 300,000 colones to buy ceramic tiles to lay on the floor of her home.

Esperanza is a member of the Raíces Capitales community loan company, one of EDESA's 110 member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles

loans.name: Guadalupe Antia

texts.es: Guadalupe Antia tiene 37 años, ella tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta y elaboración de comida, tiene más de 4 años en este negocio a pesar de tener una gran variedad de clientes ella ha sabido satisfacer los diferentes gustos con sus platillos. Ella se levanta temprano todos los días ya que tiene que salir al mercado en busca de los diferentes productos para la elaboración de sus platillos y además empezar a cocinar para iniciar su labor a las 5 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche. El financiamiento es para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, arroz, aceité, verduras, platos desechables, bolsas, pollo y carnes.
texts.en: Guadalupe Antia is 37 years old and has one dependent child in her care.  Her business is making and selling food.  She has been in this business for more than four years.  In spite of the fact that she serves a wide variety of customers, she has known how to satisfy their different tastes with her dishes.  She gets up early every day since she has to go out to the market in search of different products with which to make her dishes.  She then starts cooking so that she can start her work at 5.00pm.  She works until 9.00pm.  This loan will be used to buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, chicken and meat.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, chicken and meat

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve started his Trophy Club, Texas-based social marketing company, " Impresa Social Marketing", because he saw that many businesses in his small town lacked a strong presence on social media communities, and he realized that this was due to the amount of time required to properly manage a social media presence. He says, “It costs absolutely nothing to get onto Facebook or LinkedIn, but the big price is time, and time, literally, is money when you’re running a business.” Steve aims to take out this problem of time by managing his clients’ social media presence, allowing them to focus solely on running their businesses.

Impresa Social Marketing, which will begin accepting clients on August 1st, will use Steve’s marketing experience to create compelling and regularly-updated business profiles on social media venues like Facebook and LinkedIn. Before starting his business, Steve worked in events marketing, where he learned that social media management was an increasingly important part of his job. This experience serves as the underpinning for Steve’s business practices at Impresa. 

To ensure the effectiveness of his approach to social media management, Steve is now managing three companies promotionally. He says, “We have about a dozen businesses waiting for us to roll out the business, but I don’t want to start until I have all of my ducks in a row.” The promotional clients serve as both a tool for Steve to perfect his practice and as a way to advertise his services to potential clients. 

One of the most difficult parts of beginning Impresa has been emphasizing the importance of a regularly updated and constantly changing social media presence to his clients. “I would get a lot of people saying, ‘Well, my nephew made my Facebook page already.’ The problem with this is that social media is organic; it needs to be constantly changing in order to keep the interest of potential customers.” Though this was a problem initially, the success of Steve’s promotional clients has been enough to illustrate the importance of the type of social media presence that his business aims to create.

This loan has allowed Steve to lay the groundwork for his upcoming grand opening. With it, he purchased computer equipment, such as a PC pad, and software called Market Me, which will allow him to manage all of his clients’ pages at one time. This will allow him to take on a large number of clients without worrying about wasting time toggling between several screens.

Steve says one of his business’ biggest assets is that it is “in your area.” Working directly with clients by going to their places of business to take pictures and interact with the business owners is extremely important to the success of his business. In the future, he hopes to expand by placing account managers in other areas – this will allow him to continue to offer the one-on-one service valued by his customers while extending his business’ reach beyond its current borders of his small town.

You can visit Impresa Social Marketing’s website at www.impresasocialmarketing.com.

loans.use: to pay for computer equipment, a PC pad and Market Me software.

loans.name: Toun

texts.en: A sweet couple regularly thinks about how to make more income. Presently both of them are farmers. They have given birth to only one child. Mrs.Tuon is 21 years old and her husband is 23 years old. Both of them would like to borrow about $500 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials to support her business. In the future, she will send her child to study for a high degree like the rich family in her community. She and her baby appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is 22 years old and lives in Sabang, Larena, Siquijor. She is single. She has a synthetic medicine business and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase an order of natural medicine.

Tracy has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eight months. In the future, Tracy hopes to sustain and show progress in the said business.

loans.use: To purchase an order of natural medicine.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 68 años D. edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en el mercado el Molino II donD. venD. productos D. material plástico. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. El crédito que requiere Angelica es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsa D. plástico y otras cosas más.  

El Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Angelica was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 68 years old. She currently lives in the same city where she was born and it is where she carries out her economic activities. She has a small business in the market Molino II, where she sells a variety of plastic products. She has been in business for 10 years and it has done very well thanks to the determination she invests in her business. The loan that Angelica requires is to purchase merchandise such as plastic bags and other products.

The communal bank "Virgen D. Chapi" meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is a well-known touristic and commercial region. It is also known for the traditional feast of Inti Raymi, and it is also the location of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as plastic bags.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma Isabel es una madre de familia de 40 años, tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo. Desde hace 8 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de ganado y leche, Norma inicio este negocio por su padre que tenía una finca fue así que ella aprendió con este negocio y decide comenzar el propio. Ella tiene varios financiamientos y todos han sido destinados para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de vacas, toros, chivos y caballos.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel is a 40 year old mother with 1 son who is dependent on her. She has had a business selling cattle and milk for 8 years. She started this business because of her father who had a farm: she learned about the business from him and then decided to begin her own. She has had several loans and all have been used to expand her business.

Currently, Norma is requesting a loan for working capital that she will use to buy cows, bulls, goats and horses.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, goats and horses.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зульфия проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж и сын занимаются ремонтом автомашин. Сама она занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает носки. Сейчас Зульфия берет кредит для приобретения мужского и женского нижнего белья. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Zulfiya lives in the Vahdat region. She is 52 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband and son repair vehicles. She sells on the market. She rents out a space where she sells socks. Right now Zulfiya is taking out the loan to buy men's and women's underwear. She wants to increase the assortment of her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a reporter who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years; her potential clients are the neighbors. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of the access to business loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 27 and is married to a house builder. She has 2 children aged 1 and 7. The elder child is currently in school. She owns a store where she sells cooking oil, rice, bananas, potatoes, spices, and personal items.  She has been running this shop for 2 years and would like a loan to expand the variety of goods she sells. Her business has helped her to support her family. She would like to use the profits from this loan to reinvest in her business and create some savings for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, oil, potatoes and spices to sell.

loans.name: Slyver

texts.en: Slyver sells second hand clothes in Masindi, Uganda. He is 54-years old and is married with two children. He lives in his own house with his family. He used to be in livestock farming, but he sold the animals to get initial capital for his business. He dreams of educating his children, increasing his stock, and the money he makes from four to eight million UGX. Slyver is requesting a loan to buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Puspa Kencana Group

texts.en: After succeeding with the last loan, Ni Putu continues to borrow. She used this loan to purchase two superior piglets. She choose the superior species because they're easy to sell and the price is always high. She hopes this period will run smoothly, free from diseases, and that she'll earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy two superior variety pigs and their food

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is from the village of Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Elmer is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Elmer owns and operates a business venture, selling liquor such as beer and wine in the local community. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elmer is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2010, Elmer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Compañeritas Group

texts.es:
Las Compañeritas son un grupo solidario que acaba de recibir su primer crédito y que esta conformado por 7 mujeres que viven al poniente de la ciudad de Monterrey. Ellas escogieron el nombre de las Compañeritas porque sienten que son unas compañeras que se ayudan las unas a las otras cuando necesitan apoyo. La mayoría de las mujeres del grupo venden comidas, zapatos y ropa. 

Doña Aurelia es una de las mujeres que integran el grupo. Aurelia tiene 69 años y es viuda, pero cuenta con la compañía de sus 3 hijos los cuales trabajan, uno en un ejido, otro es chófer y la mujer trabaja limpiando una casa. Aurelia comenzó con su negocio de venta de tacos, tamales y hamburguesas hace 8 años por necesidad. Ella antes trabajaba limpiando una casa, pero dejó de trabajar porque tenía que cuidar a sus nietos mientras los hijos se iban a trabajar. Fue entonces cuando decidió empezar con este negocio de comidas ahí en su casa. Aurelia va a usar el dinero del crédito porque ocupa comprar un tanque de gas para poder cocinar afuera que es donde sirve las comidas porque actualmente se tiene entrar a preparar la comida a la cocina de su casa y es muy incómodo para ella. Aurelia espera que con las ganancias de estas ventas pueda adecuar su casa para poder agrandar su pequeño restaurante y así poder tener mas clientela para ayudar a sus hijos y nietos y darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Las Compañeritas (Mates) is a united group that just received its first loan and is made up of seven ladies who live in Monterrey.  They selected the name, “Las Compañeritas” because they feel very close and help one another when they need support.  Most of the women in the group sell food, shoes, and clothing.

Aurelia is one of the women in the group.  She’s 69 years old, a widow, and has three children who work.  One is in a commune, another is a driver, and her daughter cleans houses.  Aurelia started her business selling tacos, tamales, and hamburgers 8 years ago out of necessity.  She used to work cleaning houses, but she stopped because she had to care for her grandchildren while her children went to work.  It was then that she decided to start this food business in her home.

Aurelia will use the money from this loan to buy a tank of gas to be able to cook outside, where she serves the food.  Right now she has to prepare the food in her kitchen and it’s very uncomfortable for her.  She hopes that she will be able to finish her home with her earnings, so that she can expand her small restaurant and be able to have more customers so that she can help her children and grandchildren and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy cooking fuel.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona tiene 48 años de edad, está casada hace más 18 años con él Sr. Victoriano, tienen hijos mayores e independientes y la mayoría se encuentra viviendo en la ciudad capital.
La Sra. Ramona  hace más de 20 años se dedica a tejer frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos en la ciudad capital. Ella se encarga de llevar sus productos para comercializarlos, viaja una vez al mes y le resulta muy rentable debido a que puede colocar sus mercaderías a muy buen precio. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo hacerse de varias comodidades y construir su propia casa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer hamacas que en ésta temporada le solicitan mucho sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
Ramona is 48 years old and has been married for 18 years to Mr. Victoriano. She has grown children who are independent. Most of them are living in the capital city. 
For the past 20 years Mrs. Ramona has been sewing bedspreads and folk craft tablecloths. She sells them herself in the capital city. She has to bring her products to the city in order to sell them there. She travels to the city once a month. It is a profitable business, as she gets a good price for her products. Thanks to her hard work and effort she is able to afford some comforts and also could build her own home. 
She is asking for this loan in order to buy thread and dye in order to sew hammocks. Her customers are requesting this item in this season.
She is grateful to the foundation and to KIVA for the opportunities that they provide.

loans.use: to buy thread and dye in order to make hammocks.

loans.name: Tabitha Wanja

texts.en:
Tabitha Wanja is a 49-year-old business lady who runs a food kiosk in Bamburi, Mombasa. 

She is married and has been running this business for the last ten years and she is doing great. She was introduced to KADET and this marks her third borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour for her food kiosk. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business more. 

She hopes to own a big hotel in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en: Rosebella is married and a mother of one child. She is 32 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Rosebella used her last loan to buy school supplies and more stock to sell. Her business is successful and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future, she hopes to gain double the profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nueva Esperanza, pertenece al primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, ellas son 12 señoras que realizan diversas actividades microemprendedoras entre ellas se destacan ventas de ropas, leche, bijouterie, ventas y elaboración de comestibles.
Bettina es una de las miembros y ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo puede sentirse útil y ayudar a su familia. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de alimentos de todo tipo y dice que gracias a su buena sazón ya pudo ganarse muchos clientes, lo cual le es de mucha ayuda. Su meta es poder tener un gran comedor y de esa forma servir sus ricos alimentos a más personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, jamón, queso, condimentos, hortalizas y demás insumos necesarios para elaborar los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank belongs to the first cycle of the foundation's program for women entrepreneurs.  They are 12 women who do different jobs in small businesses, among which these stand out: clothing sales, milk, jewelry, sales, and making food.

Bettina is one of the members, and she comments that through this work she is able to feel useful and help her family.  She says she works selling all types of food and thanks to her good seasoning she already managed to get many new customers, which is a big help to her.  Her goal is to be able to have a big dining room and in this way serve her delicious dishes to more people.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, ham, cheese, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies necessary to make the dishes she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, ham, cheese, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou existe depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'élevage.

La responsable Awa est âgée de 50 ans,elle est mariée mère de deux enfants, elle a en charge son petit fils; 
elle mène une activité de transformation d'huile d'arachide et un petit commerce de légumes, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite habillée en tissu teinté marron-blanc et couverte d'une écharpe rose autour des épaules.

Elle fait la transformation d'huile d'arachide après chaque récolte, achéte les légumes ( carottes, navets, aubergines....) dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend le tout dans son village. 


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter plus de légumes de bonne qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire beaucoup de revenus; mais aussi agrandir ses activités.


Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille et souhaite augmenter le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Fallou community group was formed on 30th December 2009, it is made up of eleven women who live in the same village.Their main businesses are local retailing and animal rearing.
Group leader Awa is 50 years old, a married mother of two children, she also has her grandson in the household. She has a business processing peanut oil and does some local vegetable trading - she has good experience in both these areas.
In the photo she is seated on the right dressed in brown and white cloth, with a pink scarf round her shoulders.
She processes peanut oil after every harvest, and buys vegetables (carrots, turnips, aubergines....) in the weekly markets - all for resale in her village. With her loan, she intends to buy more vegetables of good quality to meet her customers' needs, and to generate substantial income, while also growing her business. She assists with the family's living expenses and would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: to process peanut oil and to sell vegetables.

loans.name: Reyna Yanira

texts.es: Reyna Yanira de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa especialmente para dama, blusas, faldas, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, comercia de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas concentradas de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de primera calidad, a precios bajos pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente Reyna se ha caracterizado por su gran amabilidad y paciencia con los clientes, es una mujer activa, muy dedicada a su labor, siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito; desde hace algún tiempo quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para invertir en mercaderia nueva, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa femenina por mayor. Reyna Yanira tiene buen record de crédito y tiene capacidad de pago,  asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: ropa femenina por mayor

loans.name: Les Merveilles De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LES MERVEILLES DE DIEU est un groupe  est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Medeme Juliette, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 31 ans est mariée à un certain Victorin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Medeme Juliette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Medeme Juliette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Medeme Juliette vend des touts cousus à son domicile. Medeme Juliette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Medeme Juliette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LES MERVEILLES DE DIEU un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tous cousus.

loans.name: Josephrida

texts.en: Josephrida is 22 years old. She is not married and she is a mother of two children. Josephrida is a Camfed Learner Guide helping students by teaching life skills in her nearby secondary school. She runs a charcoal sales business near her home. Josephrida requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by building a store where she can put her charcoal during the rainy season and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to expand her business by building a store

loans.name: Nadjegueton 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe NADJEGUETON 6 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso enfin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
lls sont à leur 7ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
 La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Monsieur Drissa debout en première position de la gauche vers le droite  sur la photo, il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 700.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et payer les frais de labour

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.en:
I make covers for vehicle’s seats. Two years ago, I opened the store in my house. Currently, the city’s Mayor has granted me permission to have my own stand at the city’s market. Now I plan to have more sales, since it’s approached quite a bit. I’m also starting to sell used clothes at the same stand, and it’s going pretty well. However, I need to stock up my store so I can satisfy my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase fabric, thread, strings for securing covers, zippers, and others.

Fabricacion de cobertores para asientos de vehiculos, mi negocio lo instale en mi casa desde hace dos años, actualmente la Alcaldia de la Ciudad me ha concedido el permiso y tengo mi propio puesto en el mercado popular, ahora con este puesto pienso tener mejores ventas, ya que es bastante visitado. Tambien estoy iniciando a veder ropa usada en el mismo puesto y me ha ido bien, pero necesito abastecer mas mi negocio para poder satisfacer a mis clientes.

loans.use: Tela, hilos, cordones de amarre, zippers y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Bui

texts.en: Mrs. T. H. is 54 years old, one year younger than her husband. They have 4 children aged from 23 to 30, the youngest of whom is going to college. She has a field with soya bean, corn, and groundnut. However, her amount of soya bean is not enough for her tofu processing business. Hence, she wants to borrow $500 to buy soya bean to make tofu every day. Additionally, she wants to buy more goods such as fish sauce, sugar, and dry noodles for her grocery. She also wants to buy 2 more pigs to raise. Despite the fact that she has to work hard, she is very happy as she can earn $62.50/month, which she never dared to dream of 5 years ago.

loans.use: To buy soya bean for her tofu processing business, more goods for her grocery, and 2 pigs

loans.name: Koua

texts.en: Koua B. G. is 39 years old single man. He lives in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District with his 2 children, who are in primary school. He sells clothes accessories and has more than 15 years of work experience in this business from which he care to the education expenses of his children. G. is dynamic and ambitious. He joined AE&I microcredit program in March 2004 and has been a good performer since then. He wants to purchase clothes accessories stock of products for primary school dress that has been ordered from him by a group of tailors.

loans.use: Kouao Bile Guillaume will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Gul

texts.en: I am Gul Z. and I moved to Lahore, second largest city of Pakistan from a small mountainous town after my marriage. I live in a small rented house with my husband and five children. I understand the importance of education and therefore I have enrolled all of my children to school except the youngest two who are too small to go to school. I make decorative tassels for jewelry whereas my husband runs an electric appliances shop. Together we are able to make $200 a month. My husband does not have a complete range of appliances at his shop and so many of his customers requests are turned down. We want to fulfill our customer’s needs and need more product variety. This will cost us US$550 Expanding our business this way will leave us with sizeable profits which we will save to buy a house of our own.

loans.use: BUY NEW RANGE OF ITEMS FOR THE ELECTRIC STORE

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Mrs. Lach L., 69, is a mother of five children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work as brokers buying yam and rice crops from the growers and they then sell them for a profit. They can earn collectively around $4/day of profit. Meanwhile, three of her children are married and the rest are students. Additionally, this couple is humbly requesting a loan amount of $1000 to expand their inventory by purchasing more crops to enable them to generate more profits.

loans.use: To purchase yams and rice crops to resell

loans.name: Dédé Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dédé Jacqueline A. was born on September 25, 1963. A widow, she lives in the area of Djidjolé in Lomé, the capital of Togo, with her two children. She sells shoes, which she presently displays on the roadside. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 so that she can open a little shop so as to be able to display and sell various sorts of shoes. With this loan in hand, she will be able to purchase her wares wholesale and thus earn much more profit on each sale. In this way, she will be better able to care for her children. She is counting on your support and help.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dédé Jacqueline A. est née le 25 septembre 1963. Veuve, elle habite le quartier Djidjolé à Lomé avec ses deux (02) enfants. Elle est commerçante de chaussures qu’elle expose sur l’étalage au bord de la route. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ouvrir une boutique et pouvoir vendre diverses sortes de chaussures. A partir de ce crédit, elle va réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice sur ses produits en les achetant en gros chez les grossistes, afin de pouvoir faire face à tous les besoins de ses enfants. Elle compte sur votre aide et soutien.

loans.use:
Opening and stocking a little shoe shop

Boutique et ravitaillement en chaussures

loans.name: Thi Nhung

texts.vi:
Mrs Nhung is 42 years old, she is a very social person. Beside working on her rice paddy, she also sells "bánh chưng" (traditional viet food: sticky rice cake wrapped with banana leaves). She is a widow, works hard to raise her child. At first it was very hard then things have settled. She wishes to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients for her rice cakes thus helping her raise her wage. She will be able to make the weekly payment according to th eloan term of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nhung sinh năm 1966, là một người phụ nữ rất hoạt bát. Ngoài công việc đồng án, chị còn bán bánh tẻ, bánh chưng. Chồng chị mất sớm, một mình chị tự kiếm sống để nuôi con. Ban đầu chị rất vất vả, rồi, cuộc sống 2 mẹ con đã dần ổn định. Chị mong muốn vay một món tiền để mua thêm hàng bán tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Từ việc bán hàng chị có thể hoàn trả tốt khoản món vay hàng tuần theo đúng điều khoản của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make rice cakes.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
In the El Sauce municipality in the city of León, Augusto B. has been in the business of livestock and agriculture for over 40 years in his town situated in a region called Valle San Antonio.

Augusto is married and is the father of 5 children who depend on him and are his reason for being. Because there is no electric power in his town being that it is far from an urban zone, he requested that he have a solar panel installed so that he may have power in his home to do household chores and so his children can study. When he obtained this panel, he now needed to obtain a means for payment of this debt. For this reason, he turned to Ceprodel to benefit from loans that will allow him to pay this debt and have power in his home, which he will benefit greatly from mostly because his children will be able to study in the afternoons and evenings.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de el Sauce en el departamento de León, el señor A gusto B. desde mas de 40 años se dedica al negocio agropecuario en su localidad en una comarca llamada Valle San Antonio.

Es padre casado y con 5 hijos a su cargo que son el motivo de su existencia. Debido a que en su localidad no existe energía eléctrica por encontrarse alejado de la zona urbana, solicitó que le implantaran un panel solar para aprovechar la luz eléctrica y realizar los quehaceres de su hogar y además que sus hijos estudien. Una vez obtenido el panel, su necesidad es la obtención de recursos para pagar esta deuda. Es por tal motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan cancelar esta deuda y así poder aprovechar la luz eléctrica que le servirá de mucho beneficio principalmente para que sus hijos estudien por las tardes y noche.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel so that he may have electricity in his home.

loans.name: Buburoziya

texts.ru:
Buburoziya M. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 44 years old, married and has five children. She has secondary education. She makes a steady income by breeding large and small types of cattle. She has a small farm where she keeps goats and calves. But Buburoziya wants to buy a cow so that she can get fresh milk. During the spring and summer months it's very simple to feed the cattle because fodder is widely available, but she does not have the money. Buburoziya decided to get a loan which will help her realize her plans. She can also sell the milk from the cow which will bring additional income to her family. Having five children it is crucial for her to increase her income. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Меникулова Бубурозия проживает в городе Яван. Ей 44 лет , она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Образование среднее. Стабильный заработок имеет путем разведения крупно и мелко рогатого скота. Имеет клиентка небольшое хозяйство в котором имеет козочек и телят. Но Меникулова Бубурозия хочет купить одну дойную корову , для того чтобы получать свежее молоко. Весной и летом содержать крупно-рогатый скот просто , так как нет проблем с кормами. Но для этого у клиентки нет денег. Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит , который поможет ей реализовать свои планы. Кроме того получаемое ею молоко она сможет продавать и получать дополнительный доход для своей семьи , так как у нее 5 детей и клиентке просто необходимо увеличивать свои доходы. А погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Menyikwa Jua Kali Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Hyline K. is an average Kenyan woman. She's 29 years old and has three children. She also lives with the orphaned child of her late brother.

Hyline started operating her business two years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local school in Kisii town. She currently operates a small retail vegetable business, selling kale, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, bananas, and mangos to customers in the neighborhood.

Hyline must support her children and her husband, who has a low-paying job. With the help of her loan, she'll be able to purchase more stock of different vegetables and fruits, which will enable her to increase sales. This will also enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To increase stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 29-years old and a married mother with one child. She has been selling grocery products like tomato paste, pasta, spices, vegetable oil, etc. for 8 years in the local market. Margaret will use her loan to increase inventory and sales. She hopes to start savings with this loan. Margaret is a member of the group called “Adom Mmrodo” meaning Abundant Grace. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increase inventory of grocery products

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Born on January 12, 1971 in Adéta in Kloto prefecture, Mr. Komla A. is married and the father of two. A tailor by profession, he also sells boutique items in his design shop "Tailleur Shalom". He started this business in 2004 with a simple sewing machine. And so he subcontracts out other types of sewing to other tailors who have 'plinthe' and overcasting machiness. To be able to sew any kind of clothing, he is requesting this initial loan to acquire a 'plinthe' machine and some thread.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né le 12 janvier 1971 à Adéta dans la préfecture de Kloto, Monsieur A. Komla est marié et père de deux enfants. Tailleur de profession, il vend aussi les articles de mercerie dans son atelier de couture « Tailleur Shalom ». Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2004 avec une machine à coudre simple et donc sous traite les autres type de couture auprès des autres tailleurs qui disposent de machine à plinthe et à surfilage. Pour pouvoir coudre tout type d’habits, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acquérir une machine à plinthe et des fils à coudre.

loans.use: To buy a new machine

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu has owned a small business in Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and usually makes a profit of about $50 per month. She is looking to take out her first loan in order to buy more materials and increase her profit.

Tatus is married and has one two year old child. She is 22 years old.

loans.use: To buy more materials and expand her business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
La señora Cyntia tiene 34 años está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella es propietaria de una despensa muy bien surtida y lo tiene hace más de 8 años, además es docente desde hace 11 años.

La Fundación Paraguaya ya le ha otorgado varios créditos con anterioridad y ha sido una buena inversión para su negocio. Hoy día ella esta solicitando uno nuevo para la compra de productos en gran cantidad como ser, azúcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz, cerveza, gaseosas, entre otros productos de consumo diario.

La compra constante de éstos productos ayuda a que su negocio se mantenga bien surtido todo el tiempo, ya que sus movimientos de ventas cada fin de semana es incesante y en temporadas de mucho calor sus productos de mayor rotación son las bebidas heladas.

Tiene un proyecto que lo piensa ejecutar a muy corto plazo la de vender ropas de todo tipo, ya que uno de sus parientes se dedica a la venta mayorista de ropas para damas y caballeroso y le estaría proveyendo de estos artículos a precio de costo.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is owner of a well-stocked store which she has owned for more than 8 years. In addition, she has been a teacher for 11 years.

The Fundación Paraguaya has previously given her various loans and it has been a good investment in her business. Today she is asking for a new loan to purchase a large quantity of items such as sugar, tea, meat, chicken, oil, noodles, rice, beer, soda pop, among other daily consumable products.

The constant purchase of these products helps her business stay well stocked all the time, as her sales each weekend are nonstop and when the weather is hot the products that sell the most are her cold beverages.

She has a project that she thinks she could execute in the short term which is selling all kinds of clothing, as one of her relatives sells men’s and women’s clothing wholesale and he would be providing these articles at cost.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soda pop, beer, cookies, sugar, tea, coffee, meat, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal “Amaquella” que significa “No seas Flojo” en quechua. Lorenza es casada, tiene 65 años y 2 hijos, Lorenza vive en el barrio del calvario nombre que se debe a la iglesia cercana, Lorenza tiene una tienda en su casa donD. venD. abarrotes, bebidas, algunos útiles D. escritorios y golosinas, actividad que realiza desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 10 D. la noche, con la ayuda D. su esposo.

Lorenza necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, cerveza. Los sueños D. Lorenza son surtir más su negocio, Tener días D. descanso y distracción.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the "Amaquella" communal bank, which means "don´t be lazy" in Quechua. Lorenza is married, 65 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the El Calvario neighborhood, which is named after a nearby church. Lorenza has a general store in her house where she sells groceries, drinks, some stationery supplies and candy. She works from 6 in the moning until 10 at night, with help from her husband.

Lorenza needs a loan for 1200 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, pastas and beer. Lorenza dreams of being able to stock her business with more goods and of having some days off to enjoy.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, pastas and beer.

loans.name: Sopun's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan and there are 5 members. Mr. Sopun P. is a lathe operator. He has been working since 1995 and currently earns around $5 per day. He lives with his elderly father who stays home. To expand his business, Sopun needs a loan of $350 to use for his lathe operation. Sopun is the group leader; the other members are:

1- Sambo M. is widowed and sells cooked rice. She needs a loan of $300 to add to her saved money to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to transport her rice to sell. 
2- Saron C. sells groceries and needs a loan of $300 to purchase grocery inventory to sell.
3- Dina P. sells sugarcane juice. She needs a loan of $300 to purchase sugarcane and to build a small store to serve clients.
4- Chhin P. is widowed and sells porridge. She needs a loan of $300 to purchase piglets to breed. 

This group of people lives in Prek Preahsdach Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To use for his lathe operation

loans.name: Uoc

texts.vi:
Chị Ước năm nay 41 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 1996 chị tham  gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Từ năm 2000 đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn đầu tư thêm vốn để buôn bán rau quả từ hà Nội về bán cho bà con địa phương. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ  cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang  ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc buôn bán rau quả của gia đình
texts.en:
Ms. Uoc is 41 years old and has 2 children of school age. In 1996 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to raise pigs. From 2000 until now, in addition to raising pigs she also invested in buying fruits/vegetables from Ha Noi and resell to the local community. These are the main sources of income for her family. With average income of 180 USD, her family's life is improving every day. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to invest in her fruits & vegetables business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. sells beer wholesale and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Margret is 50 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has six children, who all go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced and has two children – a boy and a girl. The boy is in the senior high school while the girl is in the basic school. Mary lives with her two children in a town called Bibiani in the Western Region of Ghana. She is the sole provider for all her children’s needs.

Mary is in sales. She owns a shop in the market where she sells rubber and plastic products such as buckets, bowls, plates, and many others. She has been in business for six years. She buys her products mostly from Kumasi. Being a single parent, Mary says it has not been easy for her providing for the children and especially, paying their school fees. She wants a loan to buy rubber products on a large scale so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy rubber and plastic products in bulk

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy K. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she makes a living growing rice. To make her farm more productive, she needs money to buy fertilizer, pesticides and fuel. Her husband, Mr. Em Bross, is a fisherman. They have three children who are too young to work or go to school.  Her husband is seen here with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and fuel to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 55 years old and married with 8 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells fish and foodstuffs. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. Ngozi requests the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fish stock and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa G. C., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 28 años de edad, con 1 hijo, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo inicial de 300 soles, que invirtió para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo en su negocio en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para invertir en mayor mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, conservas, aceites, etc) y convertir su negocio en un establecimiento de mayor capacidad, de esta manera ampliará sus ingresos y una mejora en la calidad de vida de su hijo. Finalmente refiere cumplir con sus pagos de manera puntual, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Rosa G. C. is a member of the communal bank called El Comercio in the district of Desaguadero, Chucuito Province in Puno. She is 28 years old and has one son. Rosa completed secondary school and has been working with Manuel Ramos for 3 years now. She began her grocery business with an inicial loan of 300 soles, which she invested in inventory. Today she is requesting a new loan to purchase stock, including rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, cooking oil, and other products at wholesale prices, She wants to build her business, increase her income and improve the quality of life for her son. She is able to make her repayments on time in accordance with the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her business such as rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, cooking oil, etc and continue to grow her business

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri S. lives with his wife in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. They have three grown children. The youngest two are still in college. Batsuuri carries drinking water from a well that is outside his town for sale around town. He has two horses and an old horsecart that he uses for carrying water. He started his business in 2004 and supports his family with his profits. 

Now he brings water into town once every two days, but he would like to carry and sell water every day, as the demand for drinking water is increasing. Today he has some trusted locals who always buy drinking water from him. He hopes to one day build a well close to his home and own the drinking water supply business in the town. He requests a loan to purchase extra horse feed for his plan to increase his trips to the well.

loans.use: To purchase extra horse feed.

loans.name: María Telma

texts.es:
La señora María Telma dedica su tiempo a su negocio de venta de cosméticos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde posee su establecimiento el cual ha logrado mantener y mejorar.

La necesidad que ella actualmente atraviesa es que se le ha agotado su mercadería y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para comprar dichos productos cosméticos y así comercializarlos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Telma’s sells cosmetics in the central market of Chinandega city. She has a store there that she has maintained and improved. The reason she is asking for a loan is that her merchandise has been depleted. She needs to buy cosmetic products to sell in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard K. is fifty years old and married with eight children in school. He also takes care of three additional dependent children. He has been in his business of selling generators and generator spares, as well as making generator repairs, for over twenty-nine years. He is using the loan to purchase more generators and generator spares. He has a dream of completing his building projects.

loans.use: To purchase generators and generator spares

loans.name: Abdoul Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. est  âgé de 57 ans et père de 6 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Hèrèmakono Nord de  la ville Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après l’école coranique au village, Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. décide de s’installer dans la ville de Bougouni pour mener une activité génératrice de revenus. Il  tenta  pendant des années, différentes activités sans succès.  Finalement Abdoul optera pour la petite restauration avec la vente du café, du lipton et des fritures de viande et du foie etc à la gare routière de Bougouni. Cette activité fut apprise auprès d’un de ses amis.  Avec 3 années d’expériences, Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. maîtrise bien cette activité et il est très  apprécié et sollicité par les jeunes,  les travailleurs de la gare et les routiers (voyageurs, chauffeurs, apprentis, convoyeurs etc). 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel 
Il compte acheter,  tous les jours du pain, du sucre, des boîtes de café et de lait, de la mayonnaise, du foie de la viande, du lipton etc.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à la gare routière à une clientèle composée de plusieurs catégories socio professionnelles.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Abdoul Karim D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22 500FCFA qui lui permettra d’améliorer non seulement son entreprise mais et surtout de subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. 
Il ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de  commerce générale à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoul Karim D. is 57 years old, and the father of six. He lives with his wife and children in the Hèrèmakono Nord district of Bougouni City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After Koran school in the village, he decided to get situated in Bougouni City to earn an income. For years, he tried different kinds of work unsuccessfully. In the end, he opted for an eatery business selling coffee, Lipton, and fried meat and liver at the Bougouni bus station. He learned this business from one of his friends. After three years of experience, he has a good command of it and is highly appreciated and in demand by young people, workers at the station, and drivers (travelers, chauffeurs, apprentices, couriers, etc.) In his search for supplemental financial resources, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan. Each day, he intends to buy bread, sugar, containers of coffee and milk, mayonnaise, liver, meat, Lipton, etc. Supplies are gotten in Bougouni from wholesalers, and sales are made at the bus station to customers composed of several socio-professional groups. With this loan, Mr. D. plans to realize a monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA that will enable him to improve not only his enterprise but particularly the care and support of his family. His ambition is to open a general store in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, milk sugar, coffe, mayonnaise, meat, etc.

loans.name: Tagoimurod

texts.ru: Сангимуродов Тагоимурод проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 34 года. Женат, итмеет 3 детей. Тагоимурод более 15 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. В данный момент он хочет закупить несколько мешков муки для продажи.
texts.en:
Tagoimurod S. lives in the Varzob district. He is 34 years, married and has 3 children. Tagoimurod has been involved in retail for over 15 years. He owns a store where he sells food products. Currently, he wants to buy several bags of flour for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 27 years old. She is married with one kid who currently attends school. She lives with her family in Sefwi Wiawso, Ghana. Gifty owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, activators, and the like to serve her customers. She dreams that she can one day send her child to a university.  She would also like to build her own house. Gifty says your support is much needed to realize those long-awaiting dreams.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She sells groceries in front of her house. She is hoping for a loan of N30,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Teresia is a member of the Tujikomboe borrower group. She is a 40-year-old woman, married and a mother of three children. Her children are aged 28, 25 and 20.

Teresia started her own tailoring business three years ago. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tsh.

This is Teresia's first loan from BRAC. She requested 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more material for her business.

With the profit she will gain from the use of this loan, Teresia hopes to save money, to pay school fees, get more food for her family and expand her business.

Fatma, another member of the same borrower group, also requested a loan of 350,000 Tsh in order to expand her own business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, two sons and five daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into ointment production business. Beatrice produces the ointment from raw materials such as shear butter and other ingredients. She supplies to retailers in her community. She buys the butter from northern Ghana where cost is effective. She has been in business for ten years now and wants a loan to buy shear butter in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy shear butter

loans.name: Embajadores 1 Group

texts.en:
Juan is the group coordinator of the group Embajadores (Embassadors) which is based in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) is unreliable at best.
