Here Juan makes his home in a small structure of wooden walls and a tin roof with a cement and dirt floor. Juan lives with his wife and two adult sons. 

Juan has come to Esperanza to take out his first loan with the goal of improving his business selling fruit out of a small store which he rents. This business is his family's primary source of income and with this loan he will purchase avocados, mangoes, melons, bananas, papayas and watermelons in bulk to receive a better price and increase his profit margin.

Juan believes he will be successful as he has over two years experience selling produce in his local community. With his new profits he intends to enroll his son in university. His long term goal is to see his sons succeed and to develop his business to be larger and more successful. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in bulk to sell

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Fumi sells building materials in retail to her customers. She is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hard working woman. She hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Isabel es separada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Isabel vende frutas variadas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del cementerio central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
El sueño de Isabel es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the “Hormigas” Community Bank. Isabel is 40 years old, divorced and has 5 children.

Elizabeth sells fruits at the entrance of the central cemetery in the city of Ayacucho, activity that she performs every day with the help of her daughter. Isabella is asking for a loan of $575 which will be invested in the purchase of fruit.

Isabel's dream is to have a grocery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock to raise

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom D., age 40, is married and has three school-aged children. She resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband and children. To make a living, she rents out part of her house, which earns her an income of US $3.30 per day. The family is supported mainly by her husband who drives a tuk-tuk (a motorbike with an attached riding compartment). Together, they earn US $15 per day, which is the family's primary source of income and helps to pay for all household expenses. 

D. and her family want to improve their standard of living. Therefore, D. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children, so he can commute to school easily. By doing this, D. hopes that her family will be able to cut back on public transportation services.

D.'s husband appears in the accompanying photograph.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to commute to school

loans.name: Digno Mateo

texts.es: Digno tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 11 años de edad. Estudian en colegio estatal muy cerca de su domicilio. Cuentan con casa propia de material noble el cual esta en mejoras. Digno se dedica como chofer de vehiculo pesado hace 10 años. Trabaja realizando transporte de fletes a la ciudad de Huancavelica. Cuentan con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Son una familia muy unida. Digno es una persona responsable en el trabajo y con su familia. Con el credito que solicita realizará  mejoras de su vivienda. Después del terremoto, ellos perdieron su casa y actualmente están construyendo de nuevo por partes, por motivos que no cuentan con el dinero total para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Digno is 51 years old, married and has two children who are 16 and 11 years old. They study in the state school very close to their home. The family has their own home made of solid materials, on which they are making improvements. Digno has worked as a heavy vehicle driver for 10 years. He transports freight to the city of Huancavelica. He has good personal and work references. His family is very united. Digno is a responsible person, with his work and with his family. With the loan that he requests he will make improvements on his house. After the earthquake, his family lost their home. They are currently rebuilding their house little by little, since they don't have all of the money necessary to rebuild the house completely.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa G. es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años, es madre de cinco hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el sector salud.
Rosa se dedica a la venta de pollos en el mercado y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las nazarenas” desde hace trece años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó en la compra de pollos para la venta en el mercado. 
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 2000.00 nuevos soles los que le permitiràn continuar con la venta de pollos. 
La meta de Rosa es ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa G. is a dynamic and hardworking member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 39 years old, is the mother of five children and has the support of her husband, who works in the health sector. Rosa dedicates herself to selling chickens in the market and has been part of the community bank, "Las nazarenas", for 3 years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy chickens to sell at the market. Currently, she needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, which will allow her to continue selling chickens. Rosa's goal is to expand her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens at wholesale

loans.name: 28 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La señora Patricia, es la presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento 28 D. JULIO quien tiene como actividad principal la Venta D. Viveres a pedido que reparte desD. su domicilio, la Sra. Vianca,es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa por mayor y D. ropa deportiva y el señor Luis, se dedica al bordado D. mantas D. las cholas paceñas y costura D. las mismas,el es secretario  D. actas.

Estas tres personas son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por dieiseís  personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas, ya que tienen la experiencia D. conocerce y no fallarse como Banco. 

Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 10% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio y lo acomodan en clientes fijos que ellos tienen,todo el grupo esta conformado por personas trabajadoras, esta actividad es el unico ingreso con el que cuentan y D. esta manera colaboran con los gastos del hogar, son  responsables con su credito ahora se encuentran el el cuarto credito con nuestra institucion sin ningun problema. Se conocen muy bien y se colaboran entre ellos.
texts.en:
Patricia is the president of the 28 D. JULIO enterprising bank and her business is to sell food to take away; Vianca is the tresurer and her business is wholesale and sport clothing; and Luis, who sews and embroiders mantels for the traditional bolivian chola clothing, is the secretary. This three people are the leaders of the enterprising bank, that is maD. up of 16 members, who assure the payments among them and know and trust each other as a community bank. Most of the members have a own business place, while 10 % of them sells merchandise from their home to regular customers. All the members are hard working people and their business is their only source of income, which is essential for them to support their families. They are now requesting their fourth loan with this institution and they have always been very responsible and on schedule. They support and know each other very well.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is a 36-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother to six children who are all minors. She is married to Aldwin, a construction worker (laborer). The salary of her husband is insufficient for their daily needs.

As a woman of dreams, in 2003, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started selling dry goods and it really helped them to meet their needs. Now on her ninth loan, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos to pay for a variety of dry goods.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business and pay for the needs of her six children in school.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of dry goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Needs the loan to buy more sugar and educational stationery.

loans.name: Santiago Sabino

texts.es:
El señor Santiago Sabino se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su actividad agropecuaria dedicándose a la crianza de ganado en el municipio de Nagarote en León donde ha adquirido vasta experiencia en la crianza de estos animales. Está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de cuatro vaquillas con el fin de criarlas y sacarle el máximo provecho por medio de la leche para comercializarla.

Espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para la compra de dichas vaquillas y así llevar a cabo su actividad en su localidad.
texts.en:
Santiago Sabino works hard as a small farmer. He raises cattle in the town of Nagarote in León, Nicaragua, where he has gained a great deal of experience raising these animals. He is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of four young cows. He hopes to raise these cows and use this as an opportunity to sell their milk commercially. He hopes that the loan will be funded so that he can buy the cows and continue with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four young cows.

loans.name: Joaquim Luís

texts.pt:
Joaquim luís Jo B. nasceu na cidade da Beira, Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade solteiro e pai de 1 filho de 8 anos de idade, que vai a escola. Fez o ensino técnico profissional não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu irmão e para alem dele sustenta o filho que vive com a mãe.
Saiu da cidade da Beira para Maputo sozinho para vir morar com os seus pais há 15 anos, pois na Beira vivia com os tios. E docente e é do quadro do Ministério de Educação há 5 anos e faz um horário das 12 as 17:00 horas. Foi formado há 6 anos no Instituto do Magistério Primário de Chibututuine, aufere um salário de 6.577.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária no Banco Millenium Bim.
Já teve empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA, e dicidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do Sr. Francisco Chamancono que também é cliente da mesma instituição e havia lhe solicitado para o servir de avalista no seu empréstimo. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 12.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, chapas de Zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua residência de forma a garantir melhor conforto de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Joaquim Luís Jo B. was born in the city of Beira, Sofala province, in central Mozambique. He is 29 years old, single, and has one son who is 8 years old and goes to school. He received professional technical instruction, but was not able to continue due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his brother, whom he supports. Joaquim Luís also supports his own son who lives with his mother. He left Beira for Maputo by himself 15 years ago to live with his parents; in Beira, he had lived with his aunt and uncle. He is a teacher and has been on the staff of the Ministry of Education for 5 years; he works from 12pm to 5pm. He graduated six years ago from the Primary Education Institute in Chibututuine. As a teacher, he earns a monthly salary of 6,577 MZN, which he uses to pay for household expenses. He even saves some in his account with the Millenium Bim bank. He had a loan with the TCHUMA credit cooperative, but decided not to continue with them for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku through Mr. Francisco Chamancono who is also a client with the institution. Joaquim Luís has asked Francisco to serve as a guarantor for his loan. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, which has a value of 12,500 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, zinc plates, etc.) in order to continue building his house. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to finish and furnish his home in order to ensure better comfort and living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, etc.)

loans.name: Caren Akoth

texts.en:
Caren Akoth O. farms vegetables which she later sells to consumers and to other retailers. She started this business in 2006 as an income generator since she was tired of staying home as a housewife. She is 27 years old, married with four children, and lives in Nyamasaria, Kisumu, Kenya.

Caren would like to enlarge her farm so that she can do her farming on a larger scale. This will attract more customers and hence earn more income to enable her to support her children’s education. She would like to obtain a loan of Ksh 10,000

loans.use: To enlarge her farm

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra Yanira A. C. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada, y su único hijo menor de edad, quien es estudiante. Sandra posee una pupusería y una tienda en su propia casa de habitación, en donde todas las noches se encarga de elaborar pupusas de queso, arroz, frijoles y chicharrón, así mismo durante todo el día se dedica a atender la tienda, negocios los cuales nacieron gracias a el gran deseo por parte de Sandra por contar con una vida mejor junto a su pequeño hijo y su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en ambos negocios, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas, así mismo comprando productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho por poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica y brindarle todo lo mejor a su familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 39 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband who works for a private company and her only son who is a minor child and a student. Sandra has a “pupuseria” and grocery store in her home. Every night she makes cheese “pupusas”, rice, beans and fried pig skin. All day she works at the store. This business was born from Sandra’s great desire to improve the lives of her husband and small child. She is asking for a loan from “Integral” in order to invest in her two businesses. She will buy the ingredients to make “papusas” and also perishable products and basic food products. Sandra is a hardworking woman who is able to bring a stable source of income to her family thereby providing them with a good life.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy the ingredients used to make "papusas" and perishable products

loans.name: Mazingira Kiburuga Group

texts.en:
Rashid M., age 25, is married with one child of 8 months.  He has a butchery and also sells video cassettes, DVDs, and CDs since 2002.  He works from 7am to 7pm daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 75. This will be Rashid’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to increase the inventory of  his  businesses. 

Rashid will share this loan with his group Mazingira Kiburugwa, which totals 8 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Rashid is the only man.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of meat and DVDs, CDs, and cassettes

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut N. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 'Sari Karya'.

Ni Ketut is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Ketut owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation, and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.







Ni Ketut N. merupakan 45 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 13 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Karya.


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Godofreo Lucio

texts.es:
Godofreo es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexa una cabina y que es utilizada para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda su servicio en la ciudad donde reside y los anexos que la rodean, como es su unica fuente de ingreso económico Godofreo trabaja todos los dias desde muy temprano y da lo mejor de si para sacar a su negocio adelante.

El continuo uso brindado a su vehículo y el estado accidentado en que se encuentran los caminos de la zona han hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Godofreo es una persona tranquila y trabajadora, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Godofreo is 47-year-old family man who lives with his wife and their children in Cayalti, an agricultural district located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years, he has made a living by providing a transportation service for cargo and passengers in a mototaxi (a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached). He provides this service in the city where he resides, as well as the surrounding areas. Since this is his only source of income, Godofreo works every day, starting in the early morning, and he gives his best in order to keep his business moving forward. The continuos use of his vehicle and the rough state of the roads in his area have caused some malfunctions that require immediate repair to guarantee their proper working condition. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he plans to use for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle. Godofreo is a hardworking and laid-back person who has worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when it comes time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for repairing and maintaining his vehicle

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. is married and has three children. She has received senior-high education.

Ama bakes meat pies to sell with varieties of locally made drinks at Abura. She has been doing this for seven years. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake pies and to buy assorted drinks for sale. This will enable her meet the demands of her customers.

Ama’s husband is a prison officer and, together, they are able to take care of the home. The new profits Ama is going to get as a result of this loan will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake pies and to buy assorted drinks to sell

loans.name: Nezzikokolima Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
S. Grace holds her two businesses of raising poultry and of retailing in equal measure. She is able to cut both ways in terms of balancing her financial responsibilities with the two.

Not that 35-year-old S. Grace is a past master with a lot of experience in her businesses. Far from it. The happily married mother of two is only three years down the road in her business in Kirinya-Mukono. 

Notwithstanding all the early financial glow in which she has been basking, this sturdy and always reflective woman has had many experiences that have kept her grounded. She knows that one cannot avoid challenges in the course of operating a business. 

Poultry diseases, most especially, have played havoc with her chickens. When diseases strike, they normally kill many of her brood. Poultry is a highly lucrative business in Uganda nowadays, and when losses happen they impact negatively on her finances as she has fewer chickens to sell. Luckily she has the support of her side business, which is retail. 

In a week, her business brings her about $27.  With this loan she wants to expand her poultry business by buying more chickens that she will eventually resell.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 57 years old. Emma is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emma also shared that from her income from the farm, she was able to put up a sari-sari store, where she sells stuff like sugar, vinegar, and many other goods. She hopes that her store will grow as well.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and additional store inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and additional store inventory.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun M. and her husband, Mr. Nen Net, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1978 and have five daughters and three sons. One of their children is married and lives in a separate home, four are in school and the other three weave silk at home.  

Mrs. Phun M. has asked for a Kiva loan two times already. Because silk weaving is the main source of income to support Phun’s family and they do not want to change to another business, she is requesting her third loan in the amount of $150 to purchase silk materials for continuing her and her children’s silk weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en: Julian N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.      Julian has a business of a bar.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Julian sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.    Julian has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer,soda and jerycans of local Gin. The main business challenge(s) for Julian include  Seasonality  and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and start selling on wholesale only .   Julian lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer , soda and jerycans of local brew

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen H. is from the village of Seaside, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Arleen buys and resells used clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arleen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jackson Lelionga

texts.en:
Jackson Lelionga L. is 57 years old. He is married to Emily L. and he supports five members of his family. Jackson has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members of a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to prepare the land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. 

Jackson's dream is do large scale farming and be financially stable. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals

loans.use: to prepare his land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios R. is from the village of Palutan. She is 49 years old, widowed, and has two adult children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her animals.

In 2006, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI.  Remedios is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be Remedios's ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, meat, cooking oil, rice, beans, salt, seasoning, etc

loans.name: Mirna Maria

texts.es:
Doña Mirna de 49 años de edad es soltera, sus hijos son mayores y tienen su propia familia. Mirna laboró para el Hospital Asuncion como enfermera, pero ahora esta jubilada por lo que recibe una pension mensual, ademas se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos AVON Y ZERMAT para obtener ingresos adicionales para sus gastos. 

Esta solicitando  su 6to credito con el objetivo de construir los servicios higienicos de su casa, ya que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado.  

Expresa que gracias a los creditos obtenidos en AFODENIC ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia y espera poder seguir trabajando con esta institucio para continuar mejorando su casa .
texts.en:
Mirna is 49 years old and single.  Her children are grown and have their own families.

Mirna worked as a nurse for the Asuncion Hospital.  She is now retired and receives a monthly pension.  She also sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics in order to get additional income for her expenses.

She is requesting her sixth loan to build a lavatory in her house.  What she now has is in bad condition.

She is grateful for the loans she has received from AFODENIC.  She has managed to improve her living conditions and those of her family.  She hopes to be able to keep working with this institution in order to continue improving her house.

loans.use: To build a lavatory

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga Q. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Dominga owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she buys and sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap,  toothpaste, canned goods & snack food. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Dominga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: La Victoria (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Victoria se está formado por 8 socias y un socio, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les han permitido salir adelante y ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su centro histórico que fue nombrado  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en diciembre de 1999.

La Señora. Gladis P. vive por el sector de los Trigales  en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 28 años y es viuda hace 9 años, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, su  hija  estudia en el colegio y su  hijo  en una escuela de la ciudad, tiene casa propia en donde vive muy tranquila con sus hijos.

Doña Gladis se dedica a la venta de productos  de belleza Yanbal, esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, vende su producto recorriendo puerta a puerta.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue invitada por su cuñada, con este crédito va a comprar más cosméticos. Su meta es tener un comedor ya que le gusta mucho el arte culinario.

La Señora Mariana O. vive por el sector de Indurama en la ciudad de Cuenca. Es el  primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue invitada por su suegra.

Nuestra socia tiene 22 años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora en un taller de tapicería que es de su propiedad.

Doña Mariana labora hace un año y medio en un gabinete de belleza y no tiene un horario fijo ya que son turnos rotativos, trabaja de lunes a sábados, todo lo que sabe a cerca de la rama de la belleza lo  aprendió en una academia.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de herramientas como una máquina para cortar el cabello, tijeras etc., ya que su meta es  tener su propio gabinete.
texts.en:
The La Victoria communal bank consists of eight female members and one male member who work in different businesses that have allowed them to get ahead and help their household economies. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, which is known for the beauty of its historic center which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.

Gladys P. lives in the Los Trigales area of the city of Cuenca. She is 28 years old and has been a widow for nine years. She has two children who are 11 and 9 years old and are in school. She has her own house where she lives peacefully with her children.

Gladys works selling Yanbal beauty products and has been doing so for two years. She works from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule, selling her products door-to-door.

This is her first loan through the communal bank. She was invited by her sister-in-law and will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics. Her goal is to have a dining area since she likes culinary art a lot.

Mariana O. lives in the Indurama area of the city of Cuenca. This is her first loan through the communal bank and she was invited by her mother-in-law.

She is 22 years old, married, and does not have children yet. Her husband works in an upholstery workshop which he owns.

Mariana has worked for a year and a half at a beauty parlor. She works Monday through Saturday but does not have a fixed schedule because they are rotating shifts. Everything that she knows about the business, she learned at an academy.

She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of tools such as a hair trimming machine, scissors, etc. since her goal is to have her own salon.

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, jewelry / hair trimming machine, scissors, combs, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chijipina Chico en Achacachi. El es productor lechero esta afiliado a Fedelpaz y Aplepo ( federación de lecheros del Departamento de La Paz). La leche que producen sus vacas la vende a la planta industrializadora de leche PIL; así consigue sus ingresos para su manutención. El tiene dos hijos, pero no dependen de su padre. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de ganado lechero. Esto le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socioeconómico le permite ser sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Nicolás lives in his own house located in Chijipina Chico in Achacachi.  He is a dairy farmer affiliated to Fedelpaz and Aplepo (federation of dairymen in La Paz Department).  The milk his cows produce is sold to the industrial milk processing plant, PIL.  This is how he earns income for family support. He has two children but they do not depend on their father.

He will use the loan to buy dairy cows which will make it possible for him to increase his income.

This is his first loan with Impro and the socioeconomic evaluation conducted qualifies him for the loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Jeaninne

texts.en: Jeaninne owns a business that sells cooking oil, sugar, and rice. She is 23 years old, married and has two children whom she cares for. Her husband sells clothes. Jeannine has been selling boutique items for one and a half years. Her loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, and cooking oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and continue to grow her store.

loans.use: To buy more oil, sugar and rice

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Máximo; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos; el socio trabaja en las diferentes obras que le solicitan él es maestro constructor  y de esta manera el saca  a su familia adelante siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento el socio es una persona bien optimista y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia y por el mismo el socio desea poder tener su propia casa  y espera algún día poder conseguirlo con esfuerzo y dedicación.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la adquisición de su propio terreno que tanto desea.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Máximo, 35, is a member of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO-SAYLLA” (Savings Means Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a live-in spouse and four children.   He is a master builder and works at various jobs where he is required.  This is how he supports his family and it is the only activity he’s engaged in at the moment.  Being a very optimistic person with much desire to get ahead for his family and himself he wants to own his own house and hopes one day, through effort and dedication, to attain this.

He requests the loan to buy his own piece of land that he so desires.

He is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy his own plot of land that he so desires.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tag-ube, Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store.  Her husband Alejandro B., who is 41 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 19 and 21 years old. 

Belinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Belinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, with which she intends to buy more items for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business.

 Belinda B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Surbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Surbeh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema city, in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left is Gbessay B. who is the leader of this group. Gbessay was born in Kailahum. She is married to an engineer, and the couple has two children.

Gbessay sells fruits and has been doing this business for 10 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying a larger quantity of fruits to add to her current ones.

loans.use: To purchase fruit

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Densmaa, is married and lives with her husband and a daughter in Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned since 2007. Her husband is retired and her daughter helps her with the business. 

Densmaa began operating a cafe in 2000. She became a regular customer of XacBank when she got a loan of 300,000 MNT for her business in 2005. She supports her family's needs with her business income. She was able to help her children to start their own life by using her business revenues. She is a hardworking and open-minded person who says, "I want to expand my business and help my daughter to begin her own life." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more food ingredients for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase more food ingredients.

loans.name: Alba Judith

texts.es:
Alba de 30 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, Kevin de 11 años, Eduardo de 3 y Líbida de 13 años de edad, Alba trabaja en la elaboración de loza, aprendió este oficio desde pequeña ya que su madre se lo enseño, su horario es de 8:00am en adelante la jornada finaliza dependiendo de cuantos comales necesita entregar, su dificultad llega cuando tiene demanda y su materia prima es escaza.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima: barro, nacazcol, leña, ya que sin estos materiales Alba no puede salir con sus pedidos, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener lo necesario para su producción.
Su proyección es hacer buen uso del préstamo, que sea provechoso para el negocio e ir creciendo, hacer de su producción un comercio competente, que le genere las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Alba, 30, lives in Guatajiagua, Morazán Department, with her husband and three children: Kevin, 11, Eduardo, 3 and Líbida, 13.  Alba works making earthenware.  She learned this occupation while still a little girl from her mother.  Her work schedule is from 8am until whatever time she finishes depending on the number of griddles she has to deliver.  Her difficulty arises when she has demand but raw materials are scarce.

She is requesting the loan to buy raw materials like: clay, nacazcol (seeds that yield a black dye) and firewood because, without these materials, Alba can’t fill her orders.  The loan will help her have what she needs for production.

Her plan is to make good use of the loan, that it be profitable for the business and to continue growing; to make her production competitive that will generate the necessary profits to help her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Hajra Nazir Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Hajra is 45 years old. She is married to N. A. and they have three sons and four daughters. Hajra lives in Kasur, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, that is famous for its leather industry. She lives with her family in a small two-room home in the neighborhood of Jamatpura. Hajra’s husband has a business selling construction supplies to companies and to individuals. His customers come buy supplies from him and this generates income for the family. Hajra shares the financial burden with her husband by selling shawls. She receives orders from neighborhood clients and provides her customers with shawls of different qualities. Hajra purchases her shawls from Lahore where she visits once a month. 

Hajra’s eldest son makes leather shoes and her two elder daughters help their mother operate her shawl-selling business. Her other children are enrolled in a local school. Hajra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s business. With the loan, her son will buy leather, nails and shoe polish in greater quantities to make higher quality shoes to sell. Hajra is very confident that her son’s five years of business experience will help him earn better profits with her loan investment.

Hajra is a new loan applicant and hopes that this experience will be profitable for her. She hopes to save the profits from her loan to provide for her daughter’s marriage in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem V., 36, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. V. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food and USD 50 on other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 650 to purchase more ducks to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Mercedes Marlene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella trabaja en un almacén de ropa de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, pero después que sale de este trabajo ella se dedica a su propio negocio el cual consiste en vender  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días por las noches y los fines de semana todo el dia, ella para vender más  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días para darles más comodidad con los pagos. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más variedad. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares que se dedican a dar créditos. 

Su sueño es tener su propio  almacén donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The “22 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place renown for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Mercedes, 35, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 11 and 9 years old; they all go to school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

From Monday through Friday, 8-5, she works in a clothing store but when she gets off work she dedicates herself to her own business which consists in selling all kinds of clothes door to door.  She works every day in the evening and all day on weekends.  In order to sell more, she sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks to make repayments a little easier.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise because she gets more variety there.  She’s been in this line of work for six years and she does very well.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because interest rates are lower than at other places that grant loans.  Her dream is to have a store of her own where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 32 years old, married and has three children. He has been a farmer for the past three years. He paid his previous loan well. He has applied for his third loan from KADET ltd, which he will use to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds. 

With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children and re-invest in farming.

He dreams to be a well-known farmer. He is an industrious man who works with effort to attain more despite his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer soltera de 28 años de edad, tiene casa propia, contando con los servicios de agua y luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de San José, que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la pesca, agricultura y comercio al por menor y mayor de pescados y mariscos.

La actividad que desarrolla Cecilia es a la venta de productos de todo tipo (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, pañales, útiles de escritorio, etc), en su propio domicilio a colocado su negocio desde hace 3 años, al tener su tienda en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras y así pueda obtener más ingresos para su uso personal.

El crédito solicitado por a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos, una vez que sus ventas aumenten cubrirá su crédito y mejorará su nivel de vida.  El sueño de Cecilia es tener más adelante una tienda que se dedique a la venta de productos al por mayor para que le genere mayores ingresos y pueda invertirlo colocando otro tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 28, lives in a house that she owns in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.   The house has water and electric service, but nothing more.  Most people in the area scrape by on incomes from fishing, farming and retail businesses.  

Cecilia started a corner shop 3 years ago.  She sells all kinds of everyday products (rice, milk, cooking oil, sugar, diapers, pens and paper, etc.).  She operates the business at home so she can open it at any hour, an advantage that distinguishes her business from others and helps to increase her income.  

Cecilia is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new soles loan that she will use to buy larger quantities of goods so that she can expand the range of products she sells.  She extra revenue will allow her to repay the loan and improve her standard of living.  Cecilia's dream is to one day have a wholesale business, something that would generate much more income and possibly allow her to set up another kind of business, as well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 49 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Haydee de 24 y Carlos de 15 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Reyna abre las puertas de su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus clientes, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo a su casa. Su tienda es muy concurrida, ya que es la mejor equipada de su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se puede enterar de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Para el Futuro de su negocio, espera arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda. Este será el décimo primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera la ayuda de todos para cumplir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una socias muy repelada por el oren que pone en le grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Reyna, who is 49 years old, is very sensible and hardworking. She lives in her own house with her two beloved children, Haydee, who is 24, and Carlos, who is 15, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Every day, very early in the morning, Reyna opens the doors of her grocery store to attend to her customers. She is a very persuasive seller, and she always convinces her customers to take something home. Her store has a lot of customers, since it is the best-stocked in her neighborhood. What she likes most about her work is conversing with her customers, since this way she can find out the things that are happening in her neighborhood. She has had this business for 10 years and finds that the most difficult part is having to stay inside her store all day, without being able to go out. 

For her business in the future, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her store. This will be her tenth loan with MFP, for which she awaits the help of everyone to complete her goals. In her communal bank, she is a very respected member for the order that she brings to the group. With the 2000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more products to stock her grocery store better.

loans.use: to buy various products to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, el vende lápices labiales, perfumes y cremas y también tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi y también la socia estudia la carrera profesional de derecho, la socia quiere seguir adelante y ahorrar para seguir estudiando. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar comprar productos de belleza y para el pagar las mensualidades de sus estudios.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Patron san Sebastian Community Bank which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 21 years old and unmarried. As well as selling beauty products such as lipsticks, perfumes, and lotions, she has a car and runs a taxi service. She also is studying to become a lawyer. She wants to continue getting ahead in life and save some money so she can continue with her studies.

This member is seeking a loan to buy beauty products and to pay the monthly fees for her education. 

She is happy to be receiving a loan and promises to pay back the money.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and to pay the monthly fees for her education

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilaria; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende galletas, fideos, aceite y leche, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, galletas y aceite.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilaria belongs to the communal bank "Mama Simona."  This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Hilaria is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells cookies, noodles, cooking oil and milk, and she works from 6am until 10pm.  Hilaria wants to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store such as: rice, sugar, cookies and cooking oil.

Hilaria is pleased to have this loan, and is committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, cookies and cooking oil

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en:
Adolfa is 41 years old and married with three children aged 15, 13, and 4. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Adolfa has been engaged in farming for nine years. She tills land located in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her husband. She grows rice crops and then sells her harvest at the market.

Adolfa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sithan

texts.en: Sithan (in the photo) has been driving a tuk tuk taxi [a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer or a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi] for more than five years. His wife raises pigs and chickens at home. The couple has been married since 2004 and has two young children: one son and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sithan is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a tuk tuk for his brother to launch a business driving a tuk tuk taxi.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk for his brother to launch a business driving a tuk tuk taxi.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El Profesor Luis Antonio trabaja como docente de secundaria y por la noche docente de educación superior, el crédito anterior fu utilizado para estudiar una maestría, a cual no ha finalizado y así reforzar sus conocimientos y poder brindar una mejor educación a sus alumnos, este mes es su promoción.

Su mayor sueño en la vida es lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de us familia y eso lo hará a través del esfuerzo por mejorar su situación profesiona, por lo que el crédito será usado para la compra de una laptop y así poder reforzar sus estudios que cursa actualmente.
texts.en:
Professor Luis Antonio works as a secondary school teacher and in the evening as a college professor.  He used his previous loan to study for a Master’s Degree, which he still has not completed and so he wants to reinforce his knowledge to be able to provide his students with a better education.  He will graduate this month.

His greatest dream in life is to manage to improve his family’s living conditions and he intends to do so through his efforts to improve his professional situation.  Because of this, he’ll use the loan to buy a laptop and thus strengthen his current studies.

loans.use: to buy materials for his master's degree.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La señora Jovita y el señor Salvador son padres de familia y tiene a tres hijos de mediana edad que están estudiando.
Están solicitando el préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción y comprar los útiles escolares que sus niños necesitan para empezar el siclo escolar. Ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar estos gastos y desea que sus hijos tengan el estudio y la educación necesaria para un futuro mejor. 
Doña Jovita es empleado de una compañía con este sueldo se encargara de pagar el crédito, ya que Don Salvador se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo como gestor de cobranza de una funeraria.
texts.en:
Jovita and Salvador are parents of three children who are of schooling age.  They solicit this loan to be able to afford registration and school supplies that the kids need in order to start the school cycle.  At the moment they don't have the money necessary to pay these expenses and she wants her kids educated in order to have a better future.
Jovita works at a factory and with her wage she plans to pay for the loan since Salvador will be in charge of the household expenses with the income he receives working as a collections agent for a funeral home.

loans.use: to cover school supplies and registration.

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru: Баргигул проживает в районе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 42 года. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в редакции. Сама Баргигул занимается шитьем. Она берет заказы на дому. В основном Баргигул шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 20 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей и пуговиц. Баргигул в дальнейшем хочет открыть мини цех для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Bargigul lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 42 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband works for a publishing house.  Bargigul is involved in sewing and fulfills her work orders at home.  She primarily sews national dresses and has been in this business for over 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics and buttons.  Bargigul wants to open a mini-factory for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and buttons

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who all go to school. She has one additional family member (brother). 

Sylvia operates a retail shop which she rents. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. Sylvia has requested for a loan of 400000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, 50kg of rice, soap, and cooking oil. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop and also to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house. Her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for the business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, 50kg of rice, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” y las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el distrito de Wanchaq de la provincia de Cusco del departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elizabeth nació en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos y conejos castillos. Elizabeth también tiene una pequeña tienda agro - veterinaria pero el local es alquilado. Ya son seis años que se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de animales menores. En esta oportunidad Elizabeth requiere el préstamo para implementar la mini granja. 

La socia Elizabeth está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the “Union, Fuerza, y Amistad” (Unity, Strength, and Friendship) communal bank.  The bank meets once a month in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Elizabeth was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 40 years old, in a common-law-marriage, and has two children.  She alternates her household activities with a little business raising small animals like guinea pigs, hens, chickens, and “conejos castillos” (a breed of rabbit with white fur, red and blue eyes, and used for its meat production).

Elizabeth also has a small Agro-vet stO., but the place is rented.  She has been buying and selling small animals for six years.

At this time Elizabeth needs the loan to set up a mini farm.

Elizabeth is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to set up a mini farm.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and the father of two children. 

Alaa has been the owner of a workshop since 2008, repairing cars and selling spare parts. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
 
He is requesting a $2,700 loan in order to renovate his shop and to make an outdoor ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to make an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her family dream is to educate her children to the university level. Joyce is a hardworking lady and she is in fish buying and selling – a business she has done for seven years. She has the challenge of limited capital and her dream is to sell wholesale. Joyce needs money to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Mrs. Chhay, earns a profit of $1.50 per day, and has been engaged in the agricultural business since 1990. She is the mother of four single children, and they live in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Two of her daughters help support the family’s living conditions by working as garment factory workers. Currently Chhay has bought construction supplies like bricks, columns, cement, and other necessary materials, and she is preparing to build a new house made of brick. However, she doesn’t have enough capital to hire local construction workers to build the house. This fund from Kiva will help Chhay achieve her dream of having a comfortable house for living.

loans.use: to hire local construction workers

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
This is Nazaria, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. . She is a widow and mother to her only child.  She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Nazaria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also offers a room for rent as an additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Nazaria is requesting a Php 27,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nazaria hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín ya a sido cliente de KIVA con el crédito anterior fue para surtir su negocio. 
Solicita un préstamo  para la compra de mercancía ya que le están solicitando que tenga a la venta juguetes y accesorios de invierno lo que es guantes y gorras. Por el momento no cuenta con el capital para invertir, es por eso que solicitan su cooperación.
Don Joaquín y su esposa tiene dos hijos y siempre se han dedicado al comercio su puesta esta en el centro de la cuidad de Nuevo Laredo. Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Señor Joaquín's precious loan was from Kiva and was used to stock his business. He is asking for a loan to buy goods that his customers are asking he stock such as toys and winter accessories: gloves and hats. For the moment he does not have the capital to invest in these purchases which is why he is asking for your help.

Don Joaquín and his wife have 2 children and have always worked in commerce. Their stall is in the centre of the city of Nuevo Laredo. They want to improve their family's quality of life and give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy goods for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Guayaibyty Poty. Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Paraguarí, se reúne un grupo de mujeres con el fin de conocer más sobre la Fundación Paraguaya, luego de esa reunión les gusto bastante interesante, es por eso que ellas decidieron realizar la reunión para formar el comité. El grupo lleva por nombre Guayaibyty Poty, debido a que así se llama la compañía en que viven ellas, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mutuo, actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrado por  11 mujeres.
Una de las miembros es la señora Norma, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida. Comenta que gracias a su negocio y a la buena atención que le da es que ha podido seguir creciendo. Dice que le va muy bien, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos acuden hasta su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, arroz, y demás artículos de primera necesidad. Comenta que esto le será de gran ayuda en su negocio para poder cumplir con sus clientes
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women gathered together with the intention of learning more about Fundación Paraguaya. After their meeting, they found the program to be quite interesting so they decided to form a committee. The group chose the name Guayaibyty Poty, since it is the neighborhood in which they live. They made the commitment to stay united as a group and to work in an environment of mutual respect. The group is in its third loan cycle and has earned an excellent rating. There are 11 women in this group.

One of the members is Sra. Norma. She manages a well-stocked food pantry. Norma says that thanks to her business and the good service she provides, she has been able to continue growing. She is doing very well since most of her neighbors come to her business.

Norma is requesting a loan to buy sugar, noodles, rice, and other basic necessities. She says the loan will be a great help to her business so that she can satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock feed.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 46 years old, married to Jacob and they have three children. She has sold second hand clothes for the last four years earning a monthly income from the business of Kes 28,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of Kes 30,000 with KADET ltd. She will use the loan to purchase bails of used clothes. She plans to purchase a plot with the anticipated profit from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Boolo  Dole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Boolo Dolé est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est constitué de huit femmes qui habitent le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'élevage.

La responsable Maguette est âgée de 45 ans,elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants; 
elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes,et fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite habillée en khartoum bleu-rose avec un châle noir autour des épaules.

Elle achéte les légumes ( carottes, navets, aubergines....) dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village. 


Son prêt lui servira à acheter plus de légumes de bonne qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses de la famille et souhaite augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Boolo Dolé community group was formed on 30th December 2009, comprising eight women who live in the same village. Their main activities are local retailing and animal rearing. Group leader Maguette is 45 years old, she is a married mother with four children. She runs a small business selling vegetables, and at the same time rears sheep - she has good experience in both areas.
In the photo she is seated on the right in a blue-pink outfit with a black shawl over her shoulders.
She buys vegetables (carrots, turnips, aubergines....) in the weekly markets to resell in her village. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables of good quality to meet her customers' needs, and to generate substantial income. She helps her husband with the family's expenses and would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: Acheter des légumes destinés à la vente.

loans.name: Loisi

texts.en: Loisi is 26 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. She is a Camfed learner guide volunteer for two and half hours per week to teach students life skills. Apart from teaching, Loisi runs a women's clothing business in her community. She requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing many women's clothes like kanga and vitenge for her shop. She will use her accumulated profit to open a fruit stall business and employ one person to run it.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing many women's clothes

loans.name: Alicia Julieta

texts.en:
Alicia is married and is 55 years old. She is a very active and entrepreneurial woman and always worried for the welfare of her family. She has 2 daughters (both are professionals) and her husband is a bricklayer.

Alicia has been a pensioned woman since 1998 and so she had to educate her daughters without her salary. Her pension was not enough for this so she decided to start her own business and opened a store in which she sells clothes, gifts and ceramics.
