Las tres integrantes mas  son: la  señora María Jiménez  Sánchez, quien se dedica a la venta de  antojitos, como son, el pozol, tacos, empanas y tostadas, la señora Tomasa Sánchez P. vende , comidas en el mercado y la señora rosa de Carmen Gómez pereza, se dedica a la elaboración de chorizo y tejidos de hamacas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Rosenda G. P. lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, Mexico. She is married with three children. Seventeen-year-old Hugo is in the sixth semester of his "bachillerato" (an academic high school program). Franklin, age 14, is also in high school. Karla Yadira is only 12 years old; she is a Grade 6 elementary school student. 

Maria repairs cars in a garage. She wants a loan so that she can upgrade her shop, which will allow her to provide better service. Maria has had this business for seven years, and says that things are going well. Working as a mechanic has allowed her to care for her children even though her husband abandoned them. 

Maria's father inspired her by teaching her how to repair vehicles. After her husband left her, she started repairing cars once again. Her work has allowed her to keep her household running and provide an education for her children. 

More than anything, Maria wants to keep working so that her children can continue their education. If she can do this, even her future grandchildren will be better off. 

The three other members of this group are Mrs. Maria J. S., Mrs. Tomasa S. Pomentel and Mrs. Rosa de Carmen G. Pereza. Maria sells snacks like pozole (barley and beans), tacos, empanadas (stuffed pastries) and tostadas. Tomasa sells food at a market, while Rosa makes chorizo sausages and hammocks.

loans.use: to buy tools she will use in her garage.

loans.name: Unda

texts.en:
Unda is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is his rent bill. 

For the past 3 years, Unda has operated a shoe designing business, selling in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of becoming self reliable in the future.

With the KES 40,000, Unda wants to purchase materials for designing shoes and also to establish a vegetable selling business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for designing shoes and also to establish a vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Dos De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Dos de Mayo” tiene 4 años de funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones D. banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Cusco. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad D. Cusco (Perú).  

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Eusebia que vive en la hermosa ciudad D. Cusco y tiene tres hijos. Es ama de casa y en particular es padre y madre para hijos y sus amigas la consideran una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por tener estas cualidades le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Eusebia nació en la ciudad de Quiquijana de la provincia de Quispicanchis D. departamento D. Cusco. Antes Eusebia trabajaba en la municipalidad de la ciudad de Anta, ella era obrera de construcción civil pero ahora se dedica a la venta de leña. Eusebia se dedica a la venta de leña y tiene un pequeño espacio donde guarda su mercadería y de donde también vende sus productos. Ya son 4 meses que empezó con el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más leña. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Dos de Mayo” [May Second] community bank has been going for 4 years. It is made up of hardworking and enterprising people who are always looking for chances to get ahead and every day strive for a better future for their children. The community bank's meetings are held every month in the city of Cuzco. Most of the members live in the city of Cuzco (Perú).  

At this meeting we meet Eusebia. She lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco and has three children. She is a housewife and is both mother and father to her children. Her friends consider her to be a responsible person who is kind and hardworking. Because of these qualities, they invited her to join the community bank. Eusebia was born in the city of Quiquijana in the province of Quispicanchis of the departament of Cuzco. Before, Eusebia worked for the city hall of the city of Anta. She was a construction worker, but now she sells firewood. She has her own space where she keeps her merchandise and sells the product as well. It has been 4 months since she began her business and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. At this time, she needs the loan to buy more firewood. She is 37 years old and a person who really wants to get ahead and have a succesful business day to day, always wanting to offer the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité, integrado por 15 mujeres,  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de minutas: como empanadas, tortillas, croquetas, asaditos de carne, etc. La  mayoria son madres de familia y  cabezas de hogar, lo cual implica un sacrificio enorme día a día para poder  salir adelante con toda su familia.
El comité se encuentra en su 4 ciclo, en donde se puede destacar el sentido de resposabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen  cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en la capacitaciones.
La Sra. Silvia se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comidas, ella se levanta todos los dias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para poder preparar todos aquellos alimentos que va a vender. Ella dice que todo el sacrificio que realiza es para que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas por lo que se esfuerza el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos oportunidades de progreso a las que ella no pudo acceder.
texts.en:
The 15 members of this group have a variety of businesses; the most common involve the sale of snacks such as empanadas, tortillas, croquettes, grilled meat, etc.  Most of the group members are mothers and heads of households, which implies an enormous daily sacrifice to be able to get ahead with their families.

This group is in its 4th loan cycle.  The sense of responsibility and the desire to make progress that each one of the members has shown in their attendance at the training meetings cannot be overstated.

Silvia has a business making and selling food. She gets up very early every day to prepare the food that she is going to sell.  She says that all of the sacrifices she makes are to ensure that her children do not face the same work and educational limitations that she did, and so she works doubly hard to provide her children with the kind of opportunities that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, ham, cheese, eggs, corn and cassava

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 40 años de edad. Actualmente,  Lilian vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Lilian y su esposo tienen un pequeño taller de carpintería pero el local es alquilado, ella es la administradora del negocio y también se dedica a buscar clientes. Ya son 14 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Lilian  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como laca, pintura, madera y otras cosas más. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Lilian was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 40 years old. Presently, Lillian lives in the city of Cusco together with her two children. Lilian and her husband have a small carpenter's shop but the shop is rented. She is the administrator of the business and she also is in charge of seeking out new clients. She has been in business for 14 years and it has gone very well thanks to the determination she invests in her business. Lilian currently requires a loan to purchase materials such as lacquer, wood, and other products.

She is a responsible and hardworking person and for these qualities she was invited to participate in the communal bank. It is named "Mosoc Killa" and it is a member of Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase products such as lacquer, paint, wood, and other products.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es:
Omar de 37 años se dedica al comercio de cerdo, queso, suero, miel de abeja y gallinas criollas, desde hace 12 años, estos  productos los trae de un pueblo llamado Chibolo en el departamento del Magdalena y que cuenta con un poco más de 16.000 habitantes, valles fluviales, algunas elevaciones de tierra,  sitio que Omar recuerda con mucha alegría porque de allí es oriundo.  
Su negocio inició cuando se puso de acuerdo con un amigo para vender algo y Omar escogió la venta de cerdo, pues tenía conocidos con mucha experiencia en su natal Chibolo. Empezó de casa en casa vendiéndolo hasta que logró una clientela un poco estable. Posteriormente adicionó  un punto de venta dominical y agregó otros productos como queso suero, miel de abejas, y gallinas criollas. El cerdo los comercializa los fines de semana, con un promedio de 40 a 50kls, cuenta con una muy buena clientela entre sus familiares, amigos y vecinos; su negocio no tiene endeudamiento, todas sus compras las hace de contado y las ventas de estos productos en su mayoría  también son de contado. Sus ventas le permiten cubrir costos y genera una utilidad que le permiten cubrir sus gastos familiares; sus índices de liquidez son buenos y suficientes para cancelar la  obligación que planea con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rápidamente lo mismo que sus inventarios. Sus niveles de rentabilidad demuestran la eficiencia  y solvencia del negocio para compromisos futuros. Como Omar quiere crecer cada día más, requiere para atender su nueva clientela un poco más de capital de trabajo, esta es la razón por la cual recurre a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el propósito de comprar cerdo en mayores cantidades, pues quiere ampliar el número de días en los cuales vende y ofrecer mejores precios porque planea obtener descuentos por compra en volúmenes.
texts.en: Omar is 37 years old and he has been selling pigs, cheese, whey protein, honey, and poultry for the past 12 years. He brings these products from a village called Chibolo in the department of Magdalena. It is known to have more than 16000 inhabitants, alluvial plains, and a few hills. As a native of the region Omar thinks about this place very fondly. He stated out his business when he came into an agreement with a friend to sell something and Omar chose the sale of pork meat. He knew many individuals with much experience in his native town of Chibolo. He started out selling from door to door until he gained a somewhat stable clientele. Later he started out selling form his home and he added other products for sale, such as cheese, whey protein, honey, and poultry. He sells pork on the weekends, averaging between 40 to 50 kilograms. He has a very good clientele among his family, friends, and neighbors. His business is not credit-based. All of his purchases are done in cash and product sales are also for the most part completed in cash. His sales cover his costs and generate a profit that permits him to cover the family's expenses. His liquidity index ratio is good and it is sufficient to fulfill the commitment he plans on undertaking with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). His accounts receivable have a fast turn around as does his inventory. His profitability margins show the efficiency and solvency of the business for future commitments. Omar wants to grow more each day and he needs an additional working capital to attend to his new clientele. For this reason he requests a Kiva loan. it is the first loan that he has with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. He plans on purchasing pork meat in larger quantities. He also wants to increase the days when he makes his ales and to offer better prices. He plans on obtaining discounts through volume purchases.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat in larger quantities.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has one child.

Khaled has been the owner of a laundry since 2010. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.


He is requesting $2700 to renovate and to change the decoration of his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To renovate and change the decoration of his shop.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim (pictured with her loom) is a weaver.  Her husband, Kunla has been employed in a printing shop.  They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two children, a son who is in   his4th year at his university and one daughter who is attending secondary school.  

Yim is asking for a loan of $800 to pay school fees for her son who is in his 4th year at his university.  She will use part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who is in his 4th year at his university.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Este grupo denominado Nuevo Horizonte surgió por contacto de una de las señoras con la Fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo numero trece, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007. Actualmente cuenta con 18 miembros, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto, solidaridad y mutua ayuda. Desean seguir dentro del programa, es por eso que día a día se proponen superar sus propios limites.  
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Señora Iris se dedica a la costura, ella gracias a esta labor ha podido ayudar en los gastos de la familia. Desea que sus parientes vivan una vida digna y decorosa, sin las limitaciones por las que ellas tuvo que pasar. Comenta que desea tener un local donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes las prendas que ella vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación para la posterior venta, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes con los que le gustaría cumplir. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon).  It emerged as a result of contact with the women with the Fundación.  The group is in its 13th cycle.  It has been working with the Fundacón since 2007.  It currently has 18 members.  They all work in an atmosphere of respect, solidarity, and mutual help.  They want to continue in the program.  That is why their day to day purpose is to overcome their own limitations.

Iris, a seamstress, is one of the members of the group.  Thanks to this work she has been able to help with the family expenses.  She wants her family to live a decent and proper life without experiencing the limitations that she endured.  She says that she wants a place where she can sell garments to her customers.

She is requesting the loan to buy seasonal clothing for later sale.  She now has a lot of customer orders that she would like to fill.  She is very hopeful about the loan because receiving it will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes to later sell.

loans.name: Magicas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “MAGICAS” se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Morelos. Poblado que se caracteriza porque la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican al cultivo de cebolla, este grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes, quienes se dedican a la venta de papelería. Una de las integrantes es la señora MARIA quien es la tesorera del  grupo, ella quiere el prestamo para invertirlo en su papelería con articulos como cuadernos, plumas, papel etc. la cual tiene una antiguedad de 7 años y ha logrado muchos clientes que la prefieren por su variedad en ventas, comenta que ha mejorado su nivel económico y familiar, uno de sus anhelos es el que sus hijas  de 20, 14 y 6 años, tengan una profesión a futuro y la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida, así como apoyar a su esposo quien actualmente es empleado en una constructora.
texts.en: This group’s name is “Magicas” (The Magic Ladies), and it is located in the state of Morelos, a community famous for its inhabitants mainly engaging in growing onions. This group is composed of 8 members, engaged in selling stationery. Maria is one of the members, and she is the group’s treasurer. She is requesting a loan to invest it in her stationary’s shop by buying items such as notebooks, pens, paper and so on. She has been running her stationary’s shop for 7 years and she has gained many customers, who choose her for the variety of items she sells. She said she has improved the economic standard of her family. One of her dreams is for her daughters, aged 20, 14 and 6, to have a job in the future and the chance to enjoy a better standard of living; she also wants to support her husband, who is currently working for a construction company.

loans.use: To buy items for her stationary's shop such as notebooks, pens and paper.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 37 years old and already has five children. She is married and happy to say that her husband is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. Marina and her husband are working together to give the quality of life to their children. The couple said that there is no other happiness they will obtain in their life except in giving their children the opportunity to study and become professionals. To provide her children their daily allowances in school, Marina engages herself in selling accessories like bracelets, rings, earrings and necklaces inside the school in their village. Marina wants to borrow a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional products like hairpins, hair clamps and hats to sell to her customers. 

In the future, Marina wants to put up a sari-sari store (variety) business for an additional source of income for the family. She will just make it through with the income she earns from her present business and loan she wants to avail now.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell like hairpins, hair clamps and hats

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married with four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her old parents). 

She has a restaurant business which she has operated for three years. She works from a rented shop and sells to all categories of people at retail prices. Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters, and even holidays because many of her customers are university students.

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO which she wants to use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and chicken.  Sophia wants to own a fully stocked restaurant. 

She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 58 años, es una mujer responsable, amable y muy dinámica, esta casada y fruto de su matrimonio tiene un hijo que ya es mayor e independiente. Juntos habitan en sucasa propia y cada día que pasa dan lo mejor de sí para tener una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Elena es muy practico, ella posee dos mototaxi, de los cuales uno lo trabaja su esposo y otro lo alquila. Sus vehículos motorizados lo tienen en su casa, y es ahí que desde muy temprano su esposo y la persona a quien alquilan el otro vehículo, parten de su casa para dirigirse a la calles en busca de pasajeros para desplazarlos de un lugar a otro. Tiene tres años con este trabajo, y en todo este tiempo de trabajo solo se ha dedicado en administrar el dinero, mientras que su esposo es el que maneja la moto. Sin embargo cuando sus vehículo necesitan de mantenimiento mecánico ella se encarga de llevarlos a reparar y correr con los gastos. Por ahora le esta yendo bien, aún que sufrió anteriormente el robo de uno de sus vehículos, pero pudo recuperarlo a tiempo y ahora cuentan con todas las precauciones posibles para seguir con su labor. Su plan es contar con capital para comprar otro vehículo motorizado. Este será el crédito número once con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará la documentación reglamentaria para sus vehículos que tienen que renovar cada año, entre ellos el SOAT, la tarjeta de circulación, actualizar las licencias, y refaccionar algunas piezas de sus vehiculos.
texts.en:
Elena, 58, is a responsible, kind and very dynamic woman.  She’s married and has a son who is an independent adult now.  They live together in her house and every day that goes by they give their best to have a better quality of life.  Elena’s work is very practical.  She owns two mototaxis; her husband drives one of them and she leases out the other one.  She keeps her motorized vehicles at home so very early in the morning her husband and the person she leases the other vehicle to leave home to seek out passengers to take from one place to another. 

She’s been in this work for three years and during all this time she’s only been in charge of administering the money while her husband is the one who drives the motorcycle.  However, when her vehicles need mechanical servicing she takes care of taking them to be repaired and she covers the costs.  For now, she’s doing well although she recently had one of her vehicles stolen but was able to recover it in time and now she has all necessary precautions to continue working.  Her goal is to have enough capital to buy another motorized vehicle.

This will be her 11th MFP loan so she’s hoping for support from each one of you.  She will use the requested amount to pay for the required licensing documents for her vehicles that have to be renewed each year, among them the SOAT [insurance], the registration, updating license plates and to replace some of the parts in the vehicles.

loans.use: to renew her vehicle registration, pay insurance and buy replacement parts for her vehicles.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and blessed with three children. She has been running a cafeteria for the last three years to make a living. She also does pig farming to increase her income. She has employed three people to help her to manage the business. Margaret is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a refrigerator for storing food. In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet of her business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator  for storing food

loans.name: Maro-Ya Group

texts.fr: MARO-YA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Islamia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Islamia est mariée à un électricien bâtiment du nom de Moustapha. Le couple a trois enfants, dont deux à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Islamia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Islamia n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Islamia vend depuis vingt cinq ans, des produits divers dans un marché du Bénin. Islamia s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Islamia sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARO-YA . Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Maro-Ya is a group consisting of three women, who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Islamia (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old.

Islamia is married to an construction electrician named Mustafa. The couple has three children, of whom two are dependents. Some of the children attend school. Islamia lives together with her ​​husband and children. The couple shares responsibility for dealing with various household expenses.

Islamia has not attended school. To deal with her varied responsibilities over the past 25 years, Islamia has been selling a variety of products in one of Benin's markets. She gets her supplies from Nigeria. 

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her working capital and strengthen her business, Islamia, together with other members of the Maro-Ya  group, is requesting her first credit loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve to better meet the demands of their customers and make more profits.

loans.use: Buy various products.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with 3 children. Marilou is 37 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Marilou has a transport vehicle business. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase one motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

In the future, Marilou hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase one motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 39, married, and has three school-age children. With her husband, she plans to strengthen her family's sources of income in order to continue sending her children to school and give them a better future. Her income from her variety store is not sufficient to supply all their needs. Therefore, Josefina has decided to help her husband manage their corn farming business to ensure a high yield. 

Due to financial difficulty, she has asked for a loan PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for the maintenance of their corn farming business. Josefina and her husband mentioned that this loan will help them to improve their business and they hope that they will have a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for maintenance of her corn farming business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida, es madre soltera de 36 años; vive en su propia casa junto a su único hijo Diner, de 11 años, a quien da lo mejor para que tenga un buen futuro. Zenaida, es una mujer trabajadora y todo por darle lo mejor a su hijo. Zenaida es una mujer que se desenvuelve en el ámbito del negocio por sobresalir en la vida, se dedica a la venta de frutas, trae de las chacras para poder venderlas en  las ferias del día sábado y domingo en ciudad de san Francisco; viene trabajando hace 10 años en este negocio. La venta de frutas le proporciona buenas ganancias; su plan a futuro es comprar más frutas para seguir vendiendo a sus clientes que ya la conocen por las ricas frutas que ofrece. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, está muy contenta el saber que contará con el apoyo financiero que le brindan. Agradece a su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de trabajar con ellos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar frutas como: pacay, piña, naranja, entre otros. Para seguir vendiendo a sus principales clientes.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a 36 year-old single mother.  She lives in her own house with her only child, Diner (age 11); she does her best so that he can have a good future.  Zenaida is a hard-working mother, and does everything to provide the best for her son.  

Zenaida has concentrated her efforts in business in order to get ahead in life.  She makes a living selling fruit, which she brings from farms to sell at the markets on Saturdays and Sundays in the city of San Francisco.  She has been working in this business for 10 years.  Selling fruit provides her with good profits.  Her plan for the future is to purchase more fruit so that she can continue selling to her customers, who know her for the good fruit that she offers.  

This is Zenaida’s first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she can count on the organization’s financing support.  She is grateful to the communal bank for giving her the opportunity to work with them.  She plans to use the 1,000 soles to purchase fruits such as pacay, pineapples, and oranges, among others.  This will allow her to continue selling fruit to her main customers.

loans.use: to purchase fruits such as pacay, pineapples, and oranges.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana de 26 años, es soltera, tiene un hijo con el que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de San Juan de la Frontera del distrito de Pichari. Liliana es una madre dedicada a la agricultura juntamente con su padre ella trabaja cultivando cacao, plátano y piña, pero el producto que más rentabilidad le genera es el cultivo de cacao, por que es el producto que en estos últimos 5 años subió de precio, gracias a la demanda que existe en el mercado exterior pues el cacao que se produce son orgánicos y por tal razón que los grandes acopiadores prefieren pagar un buen precio, por la calidad y el aroma que tiene. Ella está contenta con esta labor que realiza gracias a ello su pequeño hijo podrá tener una alimentación adecuada. En un futro Liliana quiere abrir una tienda de abarrotes porque no toda la vida piensa dedicarse a la agricultura. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará peones que le ayuden a sacar la maleza de sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Liliana is 26 years old, single ,and has one son. She lives with him in her own house located in the community of San Juan de la Frontera, in the district of Pichari. Liliana is a mother who dedicates herself to agriculture, where she works alongside her father cultivating cocoa, bananas and pineapples. Their most profitable product is cocoa because in the last five years the price of this product has gone up thanks to demand in the overseas market. The cocoa they produce is organic so the large wholesalers prefer to pay a good price for the quality and aroma of their cocoa. Liliana is content with her job because thanks to it her young son will receive adequate nutrition. In the future, Liliana wants to open a grocery store because she does not see herself working in agriculture for her entire life.

This will be Liliana's first loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to make her repayments punctually. She will use this 1,000 nuevos soles to hire field hands to help clear the weeds on her farmland.

loans.use: to hire field hands

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu  is a 55-year-old charcoal dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She also owns a motorcycle, which operates as a boda boda, to supplement her income.

Saumu is a widow and has been operating her business for the past four years. She is doing great. This is her third loan to finance her business since she was introduced to Kiva partner KADET. She plans to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale and repair her motorcycles. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and she hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal and repair her motorcycles.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is 36 years old. She lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Nelly is a married woman with four children. To earn a living, Nelly is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns about PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2008, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Llegando Lejos 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group, Llegando Lejos (Going Far) 2 & 5. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seybo, an agricultural area. This group includes 10 Haitian and Dominican members who have businesses selling shoes, clothing, cosmetics and many other items.

Regina plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which is a fried food or patty stall, where she sells meat, fried plantains, dough, chicken and many other goods but her specialty is fried foods. She will be purchasing meat, plantains, chicken, cooking oil, flour, etc. She is excited to be taking out her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanding her business. She will save her profits to reinvest in her business.

Regina makes her home here in a simple house with her long-time partner and their five children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them. In the meantime, she enjoys attending church. She thanks you for supporting her and her group.

loans.use: to buy meat, plantains, chicken, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Pk10 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO PK10 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la huitième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Holomè (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 65 ans. Holomè n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Holomè est mariée à un forgeron du nom de Noudéhouénou. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Holomè et son mari. Pour cette raison, Holomè vend des lubrifiants dans sa région depuis dix neuf ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Holomè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Holomè sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENONKPO PK10, un huitième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurements ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des lubrifiants.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña Maria con el crédito brindado a través de COMIXMUL logro llevar a cabo su meta a corto plazo, la de poder comprar los diferentes insumos agrícolas como: abono, foliares, fertilizantes y lo principal que es la semilla de maíz y frijol certificada la cual sembró y dio los resultados esperados saliendo adelante con su negocio y demás esperados. A ella lo que más le gusto de trabajar con la cooperativa COMIXMUL fue la atención, la amabilidad, la flexibilidad que dio dicha institución para poder obtener el financiamiento. Doña Maria solicita su segundo crédito para poder comprar abono, foliares, fertilizantes así como también semilla de maíz y frijol para re sembrar en una propiedad que adquirió la cual quiere aprovechar y salir adelante.

loans.use: Para compra de semilla de maíz y frijol certificada más los insumos para abonar y cosechar.

loans.name: Edgardo Daniel

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Edgardo and I own a small store where I sell sweets, churros, and cookies. When I stopped working for companies, I started selling in the streets to have income to help my family. Now I have my little store across the street from a school, and the kids are my best clients. With my income I can help my children with their education, and my family with the expenses. My goal is to have a bigger store at home, increase my income, and offer my family a better quality of life.

Loan Use: Purchase chewing gum, candy, churros, cookies, and others.

Hola, mi nombre es Edgardo y soy dueño de un pequeño negocio en el que vendo dulces, churros, galletas. Desde que deje de trabajar en empresas me dedique a vender en las calles para poder tener ingresos y ayudar a mi familia. Ahora tengo mi chiclera frenta a una escuela y los niños de este centro de estudio son mis mejores clientes. Con los ingresos que tengo puedo ayudar a mis dos hijos en sus estudios y con el gasto familiar. Mi meta es poder tener una pulperia en mi casa para tener mejores ingresos y darle a mi familia un mejor estilo de vida.

loans.use: Compra de chiclets, confites, churros, galletas y otros.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Auntie Helen sells utensils within the community of Pantang in the Ga East District. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has had training through TEACH lending programs. She needs a Kiva loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mr. Khim V. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their 5 children.  He works producing and selling palm sugar, earning about $2/day.  Four of his children work in a garment factory, and use their wages to help contribute to the family income.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle so Mr. Khim V. can easily transport a large amount of his product to the market.  In the future, he would like to continue storing more and more sugar that he can sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport their sugar to and from the market

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Miss. Kafui F., 25 years old, left her secondary education to pursue training as an office system secretary. Unable to find a steady position and with her limited funds, she opened a telephone booth with word processing to provide for her needs. At the request of her clients she would like her store to offer office supplies and school supplies but she does not have the resources to do so. This is why Miss. F. is requesting a loan of $900 that will allow her to carry out her plan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 25 ans, Mlle F. Kafui a abandonné ses études au niveau secondaire pour se former en secrétariat bureautique. Ne trouvant pas d’emploi fixe, et avec ses maigres moyens, elle a ouvert une cabine téléphonique avec traitement de texte afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Sur la demande de sa clientèle, elle voulait doter sa boutique fourniture de bureau et d'article scolaire mais les moyens lui manque. Pour cela Mlle F. Kafui sollicite un crédit de $900 qui va lui servir de réaliser son projet.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of office and school supplies

loans.name: Ni Luh Juliasrini

texts.id:
27 year old Luh Juliasrini is married to Ketut Gede Anugrah Artha, her tenat farmer husband. Luh Juliasrini has 2 small children, pre school age. Day to day Luh Juliasrini is busy raising her 2 toddlers, besides raising 3 piglets for fattening. With persistent Luh Juliasrini feeds her pigs mornings and evenings. Daily feed cost are about Rp10,000 (about US$1.10). Besides feeding rice and wheat shell clippings, Luh Juliasrini fed nature food like banana and tals leaves, and banana tree trunks. Before feeding she bathe her pigs and clean the stall. With an initial capital of Rp1,200,000 (about US$132), Luh Juliasrini could profit Rp400,000 (about US$44)/4months. That profit was used to pay for living expenses. With the loan, Luh Juliasrini expect to increase her animal business by increasing population, so that income would increase, and directly impact family's well being.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Luh Juliasrini dengan usia 27 tahun menikah dengan Ketut Gede Anugrah Artha, suaminya, yang bekerja sebagai petani. Luh Juliasrini mempunyai 2 anak yang masih kecil-kecil dan belum bersekolah. Dalam kesehariannya Luh Juliasrini disibukkan dengan mengurus 2 anak balitanya, disamping itu Juliasrini memelihara 3 ekor babi untuk penggemukan. Dengan tekun Juliasrini memberi makan babinya pagi dan sore hari. Biaya yang dibutuhkan untuk pakan setiap harinya sampai Rp.10.000.- Disamping memberikan dedak padi dan dedak gandum, Juliasrini juga memberikan makanan alami seperti daun pisang, daun talas, dan batang pisang. Sebelum memberi makan, babinya dimandikan dulu sampai bersih dan juga kandangnya dibersihkan. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.200.000,- Juliasrini memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 400.000 setiap 4 bulan sekali. Dengan keuntungan itu dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya setiap hari. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Luh Juliasrini berencana untuk meningkatkan usaha ternaknya dengan menambah populasi yang ada sehingga pendapatannya akan meningkat yang secara langsung akan meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedsock to increase animal population so that income would increase

Membeli bibit babi untuk menambah populasi ternaknya sehingga pendapatannya akan meningkat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Doña Mariana sells groceries at her home thus having set up her own general store. She has done this for some time and she also sells used garments. Her husband, don Richard, is a dental technician who supports her decisions. Both are responsible for the education of their youngest daughter who is carrying out professional studies in the town of Huánuco and they make sure she has everything she needs so she can continue the pursuit of her dream. Doña Mariana is 54 years old and needs capital to increase sales as it also is her wish to support the implementation of a dental lab for her husband. Let us support this industrious and hard-working mother to reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Mariana, vende productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio constituyendo así su propia bodega, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde t hace tiempo, también se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas. Su esposo el señor, Richard, es técnico dental y a través de su labor la apoya en todas y cada una de sus decisiones.. Ambos tienen como responsabilidad la educación de su última hija, quien estudia una carrera profesional en la ciudad de Huánuco y hacen todo lo posible para que no le falte nada y continúe con la persecución de su anhele. Ella tiene 54 años de edad y requiere de un capital para incrementar las ventas de su negocio ya que desea apoyar también en la implementación del laboratorio dental de su esposo. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y esmero sigue trabajando muy arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Purchase more and varied groceries as well as implementation of a dental laboratory.

loans.name: Nalukolongo 2(B) Group

texts.en: Zaria is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells new clothes/ garments. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children and solve her other problems. Margret, Annet and Madina all sell used clothes and want to use the loan to expand business. Harriet is a bar and restaurant attendant while Florence sells furniture for a living.

loans.use: To expand clothes selling business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha's family includes her, her husband and three children for whom she always wants to provide the very best. They live in a rented house because her husband's earnings won't cover both a house of their own and their children's school expenses. The principal driver behind Martha's decision to start a business was her children. She discussed her worries about starting a business with her sister, a seamstress, who helped her by sending her clothes. She began by selling to friends and neighbors and, little by little, she's expanded her business.

Martha now wants more clothes so that can offer a bigger variety in her store. That's why she's asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, that she can use to help her children and, in the future, have a house of their own. With your help, Martha will make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La familia de Martha está integrada por ella, su esposo y tres hijos a quienes desea brindarles siempre lo mejor, debido a que no cuentan con casa propia y en dónde viven están rentando, es por lo que lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa, y los de la escuela de sus hijos. El principal motor para que Martha comenzara su propio negocio fueron sus hijos. Al platicarle a su hermana la inquietud de poner un negocio, ella le ayudó enviándole ropa, ya que su hermana tiene un taller de costura, en un inicio Martha comenzó a ofrecerle ropa a sus amigos y vecinos y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio.

Sin embargo Martha desea comprar más ropa para poder tener variedad en su tienda, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y en un futuro poder tener una casa propia. Con tu ayuda Martha logrará hacer su sueño realidad.

loans.use: Buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Mahmadali Tovarovich S. lives in the region called Khuroson. He is 57 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He has finished high school. Mahmadali has an animal rearing business. He raises large farm animals and then resells them for meat production. He purchases calves at the local market, feeds them for 40-45 days and then resells them for a larger price. He has been in this business for 3 years. This business is the main source of income for his family, therefore, business development will help him increase profits and improve the quality of life. Additionally, development of this business sector helps ensure that markets have fresh meat. The client would like to obtain a loan in order to buy young calves. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Шеров Махмадалли Товарович проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 57 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому развитие его бизнеса поможет ему увеличить доходы тем самым улучшив условия жизни. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Teresa Jesus' Group

texts.en:
Teresa and Marta have been associates of the community bank "Radiante" for a little over one year. In that time they have learned how to value themselves, save, and how to discuss subjects with their husbands and improve family relations. They like the community bank because people work with them to help them understand the procedures. They don’t feel belittled as in other banks.

Teresa is forty-seven years old. She is married and has nine children. Teresa travels in the area buying grains, potatoes and fruits depending on the season. Once a week she travels four hours to the coast to sell her products from the mountains. Teresa has been working in this area for many years.

Marta is forty-one. She is also married and has four children. Marta buys house-cleaning supplies in the city of Ayacucho. She then travels to small towns within two hours and sells them at local markets. Like Teresa, she has been working in this area for many years.

Teresa and Marta need loans of 1500 and 300 soles respectively. They will use their loans to buy more merchandise that they can then resell and realize a greater profit.

Teresa and Marta plan to use their savings at the community bank to buy a motorcycle taxi that their son can drive, and shoes and school supplies for their younger children. Their dreams are to own a store, continue to develop their businesses, and to own a nice home.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Maroc Tailoring Group

texts.en:
Khalil K. is forty years old and married with four children. He is a Kiva client who received a loan of $175. With that loan he purchased fabrics, buttons and so on and earned a profit. With the profit, he embarked on tie-dye production and has diversified his business.

Khalil has customers from Freetown who purchase the materials and sell to middlemen from Liberia. He has good quality production and would like to use this loan to increase his production.

The other member of the group, Susan S., sells rice and peanuts. She would like also to expand her business.

The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2000000 ($US700).

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina relies on a small shop that is her only source of income. She has two children, and her husband helps her with the store. They use their income from the store to send their two children to school. They live in a small dwelling in the Bajo Llojeta region made of adobe. She is responsible with her credit as she wants to demonstrate responsibility to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La sra. Cuenta con una pequeña tienda que su único ingreso tiene 2 hijos su esposo le ayuda con la tienda con lo que financia el estudio de sus hijos, vive en una pequeña construcción en la zona de Bajo LLojeta hecha de adobe, es responsable con su crédito ya que ella quiere demostrar responsabilidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase of cash for her general store

loans.name: Petty-Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Alpha B. and Haja J.. They have finished repaying their previous loan successfully. Group leader Alpha B. described that first loan as a great blessing. The loan helped them improve the size and quality of their products and, consequently, the living standard of these families improved. In order to strengthen their businesses further, they are requesting an additional loan of Le 1,200,000.00.

Alpha is now 43. He was born in Kabala, Northern Sierra Leone. He and his wife and 3 children live in Makeni where he operates his businesses and the children go to school. Mr. Alpha sells items like batteries, torches, gas lights, cigarettes, pastes, tooth brushes, and so on. He has over 10 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: Expand on their current businesses.

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Мирзоеву Файзулло 39 лет, имеет 4 детей. У него особое направление в бизнесе. Приготовление и продажа пищи. Этим делом он занимается 8 лет. Он взял в аренду маленькое помещение в Центральном универмаге города Душанбе, где наняв работников ведет свою предпринимательскую деятельность. В продаже все виды национальных блюд и кое что из европейской кухни. Там у него можно вкусно пообедать, выпить прохладительных напитков, покушать фруктов и овощей или просто посидеть с друзьями а главное недорого!  
  Узнав о программе Кива он захотела участвовать. Файзулло хочет  получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fayzullo M. is 39 years old and has 4 children. He has his own business. He prepares and sells food. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. He rents a space in the central market of Dushanbe city, where he works with several additionaly hired people. He sells a wide range of European dishes. There, people can have a tasty lunch along with cold drinks, eat fruits and vegetables, or just sit with their friends and enjoy. The main thing is that it is not very expensive. When he found out about Kiva, he wanted to participate. Fayzullo would like to obtain a loan for 4,100 somoni for 12 months.


Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits, meat, rice, and drinks

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey S., 29, is married and lives with her five children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a vegetable farmer who grows cucumbers, chili peppers, and other crops to earn a living and is able to make US$2 each day. Her husband, Sokha, 34, is a horse-cart driver and also has a business catching fish from the lake in the village. He makes around US$8 in revenue each day. Two of their children are students and the other three are too young to attend school. Srey S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband. (Sokha is pictured because his wife was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Maira Yuliza

texts.es:
La señora Maira Yuliza L. V. tiene 30 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Hilos de Plata II, es madre soltera y vive en la Av. Nuevo Trujillo Mz B lote 9 Manuel Arévalo, distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú. Estudió secundaria completa, viajó a Chile donde quería seguir estudiando y trabajando, pero tuvo un hijo.
Actualmente hace almuerzos para dejarlos en las instituciones que le solicitan, prepara también dietas y cada 15 días hace parrilladas. Tiene visión de negocio porque es muy solicitada por la preparación de dietas ya que ninguna otra persona de la zona lo elabora.
Con este primer préstamo de 300 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas compró una olla arrocera de tamaño grande.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará arroz y aceite.
Maira sueña con tener un restaurant grande que sea muy concurrido.
texts.en:
Maira Yuliza L. V. is 30 years old and belongs to the “Hilos de Plata II” (Silver Threads II) communal bank. She is a single mother and she lives on Nuevo Trujillo Avenue, Block B, Lot 9 Manuel Arévalo, in the Huanchaco district of Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed high school, and traveled to Chile, where she wanted to continue studying and working, but she had a child. She now makes lunches and takes them to the institutions that request them. She also makes special order foods and does a barbeque every 15 days. She has a vision for business because she is very sought after for special order foods, since no one else in the area makes them. With her first loan of 300 soles, which will repaid in 4 payments, she bought a large rice cooker. With this loan of 300 soles, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy rice and cooking oil. Maira dreams of having a big restaurant that will have many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 42-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He is an auto repairer. He has requested a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua to buy new merchandise for his garage. It is his first time that he asked for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his garage

loans.name: Pierre

texts.fr: Né vers 1973 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO au Bénin, monsieur  B. Pierre est marié et père de 8 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de HÊTIN SOTA où se trouve la source thermale de DANGBO dans la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement    GH MIWANOU DE HÊTIN SOTA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 165 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo in Bénin, Mr. Pierre B. is married and the father of 8 children, of whom one is enrolled in school. He is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota where the hot springs of Dangbo are located, in the valley of the Ouémé River, and he is a member of the group GM Miwanou of Hetin Sota.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Bénin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing the land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Pierre B. has requested a loan of 165,000 F CFA which will allow him to farm about 2 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating about 2 hectares, in corn and hot peppers

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa L. is married with children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to villagers and the general public two days per week. 

She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Temukisa’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  Part of the loan will be used for buying timbers and iron-roofs for home improvement

loans.use: Purchase buying pesticides, fertilizers, chemicals and bush knives

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Jamal has been working as a scrap metal dealer for twelve years. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work and also to paint his house. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. Jamal is special in his work because he is trustful and he likes his work a lot. His clients can be anybody.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his work and paint his house

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has two daughters. She has two business locations where she sells women's shoes.  Irina started her business 10 years ago. She quit her job and together with her husband began a shoe retail business. Irina offers her clients good quality shoes and good treatment. She always helps her clients to choose shoes that fit best. The clients value this service and come back.

This business is the only source of income for Irina's family. Irina became a grand mother recently. Now she helps her daughter's young family financially. Irina’s younger daughter is a university student (in her last year) and Irina helps  to pay for the tuition.

Irina would like to receive a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. Her goal is to develop this business further and open a third location.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Basita

texts.es:
La señora Basita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en el Jr. Grau Cdra. 04, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 37 años y es madre de 2 hijos, uno que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inició, con S/. 300.00 y fue por iniciativa propia, quien decidió emprender su negocio y empezó vendiendo refrigerios y anticuchos en un kiosco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y cosméticos, cuenta con un local especialmente  acondicionado en su propia casa.

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, y también útiles escolares como lapiceros, lápices, plumones, correctores, borradores, cartulinas y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es una mujer muy luchadora y constante en sus metas que desea lograr y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Dany, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Basita belongs to the community bank "Picota" and lives at Jr. Grau block 4, Picota district, San Martin state. She is single, 37 years old, and a mother of 2 children, one of whom she still supports. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she decided to start her own business selling sandwiches and meat skewers at a stand. Currently, she sells groceries and cosmetics, specialized according to her area because she sells them from her home. With a loan of S/ 3,000, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she will invest in more products to grow her business such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, fish preservatives, personal hygiene products, and cleaning products. Also, she would like to sell pens, pencils, erasers, and flashcards in order to keep her customers happy. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for her business. Personally, she is a woman who is a fighter works to accomplish her goals, and is responsible with her monthly payments. She would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, groceries, personal hygiene products, and tools to grow her business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia sells clothing in the central marketplace of Beregovo. She offers a nice selection of merchandise for sale in her kiosk. Sylvia ventured to launch her own small business about 8 years ago. Currently, she has 18,000 Grivnas ($2,375 US) in working capital. Net profit amounts to 2,000-2,300 Grivnas a month. 

Sylvia is seeking a 1,700 Grivna ($225 US) loan to add to her stock and meet the growing demand. She has already repaid several loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. We believe her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.  

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in 6 weeks.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Las Principiantes Group

texts.es: Hace mas de siete años trece mujeres  conforman la asociación “Las Principiantes” que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer, convencidas de que pueden mejorar su calidad de vida. La mayoría de ellas viven en la zona Juan Pablo II,  de la ciudad de el Alto, siendo el comercio informal la  actividad mas común entre ellas, venden; CDS, repuestos para automóviles, verduras, frutas y otros,productos que son comercializados en mercados y calles  del lugar. La asociación Las Principiantes, afirman que el alza de los precios en los alimentos de primera necesidad causo desequilibrio en la economia de sus hogares, lo que les lleva a solicitar créditos para inyectar capital a sus negocios, con el unico fin de mantener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Seven years ago 13 women formed their own collective "Las Principiantes", working with Pro-Mujer, in order to improve their quality of life. They mostly live in the Juan Pablo II area of the city of Alto. They work primarily in informal businesses such as selling CDs, automobile parts, fruits and vegetables, as well as other products, which they sell at markets and on their local streets. They household finances have suffered from the price increases for primary necessities. They are requesting this loan in order to inject some capital into their businesses and stabilize their household incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for their businesses

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 51 years old and manages an eatery business in their village at Magsaysay Saguday, Quirino. She also sells snacks, soft drinks and other goods just beside her eatery. Florence has been blessed with three children. Her children are: Nestor, 30 years old, and who was only able to study through high school; Edmundo, 29 years old who finished a mechanical vocational course; and the youngest is Sheryl, 27 years old and a high school graduate as well. Her children are all responsible and always give her a helping hand, especially with her business.

Florence is seeking additional working capital for her business and she sees ASKI as a potential solution to her financial problem. She believes that ASKI will support her business and will provide many benefits to her life since ASKI also offers insurance and business training among other benefits. She hopes to make her eatery more productive and able to make higher profits. She is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000.00 which will be used to expand her business by purchasing cases of soft drinks and additional vegetables to be sell in her business stall. She hopes that her small business will become successful someday for the benefit of her family especially for the future of her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aurelio Jr.

texts.en:
Aurelio is managing a welding shop in their village of Rizal Santiago City. He has managed the business for about seven years.

Having enough financial assistance for his business will enable him to improve his business. That is why he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to supply the needs of his family and to continue to support the schooling of his two children who are Marc Ceasar - 15 years old, third year high school student, and Vaneza Rose - 9 years old, grade three pupil in the elementary school.

He is hoping that he can obtain the loan he is requesting to also use in purchasing materials for his welding shop. Aurelio is 40 years old and happily married to Jolly M..

loans.use: To use in purchasing materials for his welding shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace B. is forty years old and a married mother of five children, two daughters and three sons. She lives with them and her husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Grace is a hard-working woman. She runs a grocery store with her husband, selling provisions such as coffee, Milo, flour, sugar, rice, candy and bread in a store on the street. Grace has been in business for eighteen years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Luz En El Camino 2 Group

texts.en:
Just a few kilometers from Samaná, in the Dominican Republic, Anita H. has made a living selling cake, cookies, candies and other treats from her home to those in her neighborhood. Using the recipes she learned as a child, along with a few of her own, Anita has a corner on the baked goods market in her area. She sells these treats from her house, where she lives with her husband José and their five children. Anita loves her job. She began selling baked goodies because she is good at it and because she considers it to be less complicated than other tasks. She states that she doesn’t want the complications of taking people’s clothes to wash, or other services – she enjoys the simplicity of giving someone a few cookies over the counter in exchange for payment.

Anita has exciting goals for the future of her family and her business. She has a passion for wanting her business to continue to grow – and with this being her 6th loan cycle with Esperanza, she has shown commitment to her work. She started out small, and with each loan cycle she has been able to expand her business even more. This has benefitted her family as well. Anita is seeking to build up savings for her children. She will be able to help with any future costs, including university tuition fees. These savings will give Anita the ability to help her family in a greater array of situations that may arise in the future. This is the reason that she is focusing on saving and expanding her business.

Anita, pictured here far left, is the leader of this group of women named Luz en el Camino (Light on the Road), and her story is emblematic of the other women in her group.  Anita and the rest of Luz en el Camino thank you for your help with this Kiva loan!

loans.use: To buy ingredients used for cookies, bread and other baked goods.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en su motocarro, ella a sus 34 años, es madre de 4 hijos que aun están estudiando. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, productos comestibles y bebidas, en un  espacio que acondicionó en su casa para su pequeña tienda. Para esta labor cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes cuando están libres de sus tareas escolares, la ayudan con la atención de los clientes. Para ella es muy importante dar una muy buena atención a las personas que visitan su bodega para comprar sus productos, además esta actividad la hace sentirse útil ante la sociedad. Asimismo, Aydee está muy satisfecha con su tienda porque le está generando buenos ingresos, los cuales están incrementando su nivel económico para poder vivir tranquila y sin preocupaciones. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está a gusto con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son personas responsables y el grupo es muy unido. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más abarrotes, gaseosas y productos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Aydee lives with her husband, who works in public transport. She is 34 years old and a mother of 4 children that are schoolaged. For 2 years she has been working selling groceries, food and drinks, in a space that she set up in her house for the small store. Her children help her with the store when they don't have schoolwork. To her it is very important to provide the customers that visit her store with good service; in addition, having the store makes her feel useful in the community. Aydee, is very satisfied with her store because it is generating good income, which is increasing her economic ability to live tranquility and without worries. This is her second loan with MFP and she likes her communal bank because the other members are responsible people and the group is very united. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase more groceries, sodas and necessity products to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her store merchandise

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Soem S. is a 24-year-old farmer who lives in the province of Pursat. She also has handicraft equipment which she uses to weave brooms for sale.  Her husband raises pigs and works on their farm. Soem S. married years ago and is blessed with one young child who is in school. Soem S. wants to grow rice but she lacks the money to do so. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to purchase three sacks of fertilizer and to hire a labourer to plough a piece of her farmland. She will then begin planting a rice crop. She and her husband are pictured in their field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to hire a labourer

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en: M. Irene is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 25 years old and married with 3 children aged 5, 3 and 1 year. Her first-born child is in school. Hers is a success story. M. got pregnant with her first child while still very young. Her (now) husband has helped to make sure she continues her schooling at the University on the evening programme. During the day, M. is a businesswoman operating a grocery store. She sells general merchandise in Kirinya trading centre. She also has a poultry business at home with broilers for meat. She is a hard working young lady with a strong drive to succeed in life. Irene needs a loan to help buy more goods for her shop. She will use the funds to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread and so on, as well as to buy chicken feed for her broilers.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop, as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Vilma del Socorro C. vende en su establecimiento los productos del hogar como perchas, pastes, cepillos, tendedores de ropa, entre otros. El crédito que ha solicitado lo utilizará para la compra de dichos productos para abastecer el negocio y por esta razón es que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el apoyo por medio de dicho crédito para suplir su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de los productos

loans.name: Kuburat

texts.en: Kuburat sells sarongs of various colours and shapes. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La señora Eleuteria es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 65 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Central, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar D. ganado vacuno para engorD., tambié tienen ganado ovino para engorD..

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y los encuentros,
texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria is a member of the communal bank “Vírgen del Rosario” located in Villa Queñuani, Yunguyo District, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 65 years old, is married, and has two children. She lives in the Central neighborhood and she has completed primary school (6th graD.). Eleuteria has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost one and a half years. Her first loan was for PEN 500, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling cattle. Today, she is requesting a new loan of PEN 1,000, which will allow her to buy more cows, fatten them up, then resell them. She already raises sheep to fatten and sell. Faustina's biggest wish is to keep working. She loves to save and to go to gatherings.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Melba Isabel

texts.en: Melba Isabel has three children, ages 6, 9, and 12, and all are in school. Melba Isabel is 36 years old. She manages two businesses: the sale of clothing and the butchering of pigs (pictured). She began her clothing business about six years ago, selling clothing on foot when her husband was ill and could not work for an extended period of time. She now uses her home as display space for her merchandise. She will use this loan to purchase more clothing merchandise, adding to her selection of products. Melba Isabel dreams of being able to ensure that her children don’t go without a meal everyday and that she will be able to provide a good education for them.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 22 años, es soltera, vive en su casa propia, y lo que más desea es forjarse una buena vida.
Su carisma es una de sus armas más importantes a la hora de desempeñar su labor, ella es la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en la combi número 12 que brinda servicio de transporte urbano por las calles de Juliaca. Su día comienza muy temprano por la mañana, teniendo que permanecer en su labor hasta casi las 9 de la noche.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede conversar con sus pasajeros y hacer más ameno el viaje, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día parada, ya que los pasajeros ocupan todos los asientos. 
Para más adelante, anhela tener su propia combi, con la cual pueda trabajar y obtener sus propias ganancias.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nilda con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los dos mil soles solicitados planea apoyar en los arreglos de la combi donde trabaja, ya que si se malogra, ella no tendrá trabajo.
texts.en:
Nilda, 22, is single and lives in her own home; her greatest wish is to build a good life for herself. Her charisma is one of her most powerful weapons in her work since she is the person charged with collecting fares onboard minibus #12 which provides urban public transportation services on the streets of Juliaca. Her workday begins very early in the morning and doesn't end until almost 9 at night. What she most enjoys about the job is being able to converse with the passengers and make the trip more pleasant. She has had this job for two years and feels that the most difficult part of it is having to stand all day since the passengers take up all the available seats. For later in the future she would like to own her own minibus with which to work and earn her own profits. This is Nilda's fourth loan with MFP. She is aware that she needs to repay in a timely fashion and is prepared to do so since she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she is a well-liked and admired member. With the 2,000 soles requested she plans to help defray repay costs for the minibus that she works on because if it breaks down she won't have a job.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Minibus repair.

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Sea K., 47, is a widow with two school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her parents and children. To make a living, she runs a business of selling Cambodian traditional foods made from fish. This kind of food can be kept for a very long time over the year. She is able to earn an income of US $5.9 per day.

K. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more traditional food to expand her business.
