Doña Jacinta aprendió porque nació y creció en una familia agricultora y cuando se casó continuó dedicándose a esta actividad, fruto de su matrimonio tiene un hijo de 17 años al cual ama mucho y por el sigue esforzándose en las tareas agrícolas, siembra en sus campos de cultivo papa, olluco habas, avena y cebada y en estos últimos años sobre todo el año anterior se ha visto perjudicada por el terrible frío que azotó la zona centro de nuestro país, ese hecho le generó una gran pérdida y a pesar de la tristeza que aún inunda su corazón está decidida a seguir trabajando; debido a que está planeando instalar una tienda de abarrotes en el que ofertará los productos que obtiene de sus campos de cultivo.Doña Jacinta y su esposo invertirán vuestra generosa ayuda en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes.Apoya a una mujer llena de experiencia y buenas intenciones para el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizers

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. has a small business selling charcoal in the city of San Lorenzo. She has three children and a husband who once worked in construction. But when he realized how profitable his wife’s company was, he left construction and went into business with her. Now they work together selling bags of charcoal to local businesses.

Elena has applied for a loan to buy more heir merchandise to sell. She hopes to continue to increase the size of their business so that she can afford to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Sergio Rene

texts.es:
Mr. Sergio is 39 years of age and lives in Ticuantepe County. He works in the Territorial Studies Institute (INETER) as a hydromensor technician (measuring water levels). His family depends entirely on his only income to survive. Thanks to several microloans this family has been able to improve the poor conditions of their home. His wife takes care of their only child and Mr.Sergio wants to improve their living conditions so that they may lead a fuller life.

Through hard work and perseverance Mr.Sergio wants to improve the life of his family. He hopes to be able to give his son a proper education so he can have a career and to see him grow healthy and fulfilled.

To this end, Mr.Sergio is requesting a microloan which will improve his son´s bedroom and provide him with a tile floor in their living room as their current flooring is in a very poor state.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy O. sells dried fish. She is married with 5 children and is 42 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1996. She needs the loan of $600 to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is the 35 year old married mother of five, who are all in school. She lives with her husband in the Sagam village of Siaya. She is a member of Schobac, a community based group. Jane is a full-time farmer who also sells fish to the local community. She buys fish (tilapia) in bulk from Yimbo--one of the beaches--and then sells to most of the hotels in Luanda. Despite stiff competition, increase in fish prices, and high transport cost, Jane has managed her business well. She requires $600.00 to invest in her fish business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Expand her fish business.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen B., wife of M., has been living in the city named Vehari, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She has two sons. Waqas is 18-years-old and due to family circumstances, he has only been educated through the fifth level of school. The second son, Nouman, 15, is in the 9th level.

M. drives his own rickshaw which was purchased through a previous loan. Waqas helps his father in his work. They are requesting a new loan to repair the body of the auto-rickshaw.

Parveen B. is the leader of her group. Mussarat B. would use the loan for agriculture. Kosar B. would buy a rickshaw. Kalsoom B. wants to buy a sewing machine and Shahnaz B. wants the money to start a cloth business.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand and start businesses, repair a rickshaw and purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ramatou O. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children in a monogamous household in Hamdallaye, one of the districts in the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

From the age of 7, she has engaged in revenue-generating activities, notably the sale of condiments, with her mother. With 32 years of experience, she enjoys a reputation and renown unequalled in the town of Sikasso.

To deal with the frequent stock shortages at the level of the grand market in Sikasso, she decided to take part in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso in order to create a sufficient stock for a longer period of time.

In 5 years of collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, she has obtained 3 solidarity loans and is on her second individual loan. With the current loan, she intends to buy 10 boxes of canned tomato concentrate, 2 bags of dried onions, 2 bags of pepper, 2 bags of Lorié leaves, and 5 boxes of food cubes from the grand market in Sikasso. She sells her wares in bulk for cash or on credit at the new market in Hamdallaye where she runs this business. The products are displayed on a large table and retailed to a clientele composed essentially of females. She intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, with which she will pay off the interest on her loan, contribute to her family's expenses, and invest in her business.

Mrs. Ramatou O. intends to become a wholesaler able to supply the resupply the retailers in the market in the town of Sikasso.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Ramatou O. a 41 ans et vit avec 6 enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).

Dès l’age de 7 ans elle a commencé les activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente de condiments auprès de sa mère .Avec 32 ans d’expériences elle jouit d’ une réputation et d’une notorieté sans égale dans la ville de Sikasso.

Pour faire face aux ruptures de stock fréquentes au niveau du grand marché de Sikasso, elle décida d’integrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir constituer un stock suffisant pour une période un peu plus longue.

En 5 ans de collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso, elle a obtenu 3 prêts solidaires et est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Avec le prêt actuel, elle compte achéter 10 cartons de concentré de tomate en boite, 2 sacs d’oignons sèchées, 2 sacs de poivre, 2 sacs de feuilles de Lorié, 5 cartons de cubes alimentaires au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle vend en gros au comptant ou à crédit au nouveau marché de Hamdallaye où elle mène cette activité .Les produits son étalés sur une grande table et vendu en détail à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100000 FCFA. avec lequel elle payera les intérêts de son prêt, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, et investir le reste dans son activité.

Madame Ramatou O. envisage devenir une grossiste pouvant ravitailler les détaillants du marché de la ville de Sikasso.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Volver A Empezar Group

texts.es:
The center of Alto Lima is located in the Ballivian zone in the city of El Alto which is where the "Volver a Empezar" Association is found. They work with great responsibility with their payments and internal activities. Within the group, many of the women lack basic services in their homes. For example, doña Verni cannot rely on potable water that should be supplied by public water basins. What's more, like many others, she cannot rely on gas services and must buy gas in tanks. Lamentably, she lives in a zone where distributors of these tanks do not pass very frequently which is why she has to go to busy streets in the hopes that one of these trucks will pass by. She longs to be able to rely on these services in her home. The main activity of this group is the weaving of sweaters, scarves, and other pieces of clothing, in Alpaca wool that they later sell in the "16 de julio" market in the city of El Alto. Currently, they want to be able to increase their production so that they can sell their products to handicraft shops. It is for this that they need more capital for the acquisition of raw materials to make their sweaters. They have the security of increasing their income, in this manner they will also be able to improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El centro focal de Alto Lima esta ubicada en la zona Ballivian de la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “ Volver a Empezar ” que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas. Dentro el grupo muchas de ellas carecen de servicios básicos en sus casas por ejemplo doña Verni no cuenta con agua potable por lo que debe abastecerse de agua en piletas publicas, además como muchos tampoco cuenta con servicio de gas y debe comprar gas en garrafas de distribuidores, lamentable es que ella vive en una zona donde estos camiones distribuidores no pasan muy seguido, por lo que debe ir a calles concurridas a esperar que pase el mencionado camión, ella anhela poder contar con estos servicios en su domicilio. La actividad principal de este grupo es el tejido de chompas, mantillas y otras prendas de vestir, en lana de alpaca que luego las venden en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Actualmente desean poder aumentar su producción para, vender sus productos a tiendas artesanales, por lo que necesitan mayor capital para la adquisición de materia prima para la confección de sus chompas. Tienen la seguridad de mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera mejorar también la calidad de vida de sus familias.

loans.use: They need capital for the purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Thi Ly's Group

texts.vi:
chị Nguyễn thị Lý Ms 06020001 năm nay 54 tuổi, chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt, Đồng thời chị còn rất tích cực tham gia phong trào của nhóm, cụm. Lần này chị đăng ký tham gia vay ở mức 4.265.000 VND dể đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hàng tạp hoá, chồng chị đi làm thợ xây, con chị đi làm có thu nhập ổn định, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình mỗi ngày thu được từ 130.000 VND đến 150.000 VND / ngày. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Dành Ms 06020002 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi
  • chị Nguyễn thị Cam Ms 06020004 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • anh Nguyễn văn Giang Ms 06020005 vay mức 1.568.000 VND để mua cám bò
  • Nguyễn thị Liễu Ms 06020013 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua than đóng gạch
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ly (ID Number 06020001), 54 years old, has already obtained one loan through the SEDA Fund and repaid the loan fully. She is always actively involved in the activities of the group. This time, she would like to borrow 4,265,000VND to invest in rearing pigs. Everyday, she manages her general store in the market while her husband works as a construction worker. Her children are also all working with stable incomes, so her family's daily income reaches 130,000VND to 150,000VND (about 8.20USD to 9.40USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Danh (ID Number 06020002), borrows 4,256,000VND to raise cattle.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Cam (ID Number 06020004), borrows 3.360,000VND to purchase breeding pigs.
  • Mr. Nguyen Van Giang (ID Number 06020005), borrows 1,568,000VND to purchase cow feeds.
  • Mrs. Nguyen Thi Lieu (ID Number 06020013), borrows 4,256,000VND to make bricks.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Un Hay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Un H. is the village bank president. She is 33 years old, and the mother of three children; two of whom are attending the local school. Her youngest child is only three years old, and thus too young to study or work. The village bank, which is comprised of seventeen members, is located in Tuol Sralau Village in Kampong Chang Province.

Mrs. Un H. is also a farmer in the local village, where she owns a 1.5 hectare rice field. Presently, however, she faces a small problem in her field, as she needs fertilizer, which is quite expensive. Her husband, Mr. Choem Hoeun, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make US $2.5 per day. He also helps his wife in the field, but their income is small for their family. As a result, Un is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers in order to produce better crops.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product, because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. This type of loan allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term, but most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers in order to produce better crops.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La dama Reyna Martínez es originaria del municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León y se dedica al negocio de ventea de artesanía el cual las compra y a la vez las prepara para su comercialización.

La habilidad para la elaboración de dichas artesanías la adquirió de su mamá el cual también se dedicaba a este negocio siendo de esta manera que ella aprendió. El motivo por el cual solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de material de trabajo para continuar con su venta y elaboración de las artesanías.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna M. is originally from the city of Leon. She sells pottery which she buys and then she prepares them to sell.

She acquired this skill from her mother who's also a pottery artist. She's requesting this loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase the material needed to make these works of arts so that she may continue selling and working on pottery.


Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de material de trabajo

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophors C. is 24 years old and lives in Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province. She has two kids; one lives at home, and other one is in school.

Sophors is farmer who has worked her rice crop with her husband, Mr. Vuthy Pen, 25, for income for her family. Sophors is applying a loan of 800,000 riel ($200) to purchase home products and goods to sell by transporting to customer’s houses.

(Sophors and her husband are pictured)

loans.use: to purchase home products and goods

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: Née vers 1973 à  AHOVILECOME  dans la commune de DANGBO, dame   D. Y. Rosaline est mariée et mère de 4enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GF MAHUKPEGO DE HÊTIN SOTA ; elle vend aussi du poisson fumé et de l’huile de palme. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Ahovilecome, in the township of Dangbo, Mrs. Rosaline D. Y. is married and the mother of 4 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Hetin Sota in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GF Mahukpego of Hetin Sota. She also sells smoked fish and palm oil. The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land. The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Rosaline D. Y. has requested a loan of 150,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 2 hectares, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 2 hectares in corn and hot peppers

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and is married with two children. Eva buys and sells grain for a living. She buys the grain in the markets of the city of Ayacucho, and travels by bus to bring them to different towns in the jungle to sell. She has been in this business for the past five years. 

Eva is requesting a loan of 1800 soles to buy wheat, barley and other grains. Her goal for the future is to open her own store in her home.

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley and other grains

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes  mariées et ont en moyenne de 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec leurs coépouses, frères et sœurs, et enfants dans le village de Yolla sous préfecture de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro (République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par les relations de voisinage. Dans l’intention de pouvoir acheter beaucoup de lait et servir plus de clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer le programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur dixième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes veulent acheter avec ce prêt, 500 litres de lait auprès des éleveurs de Yolla et environs pour les revendre(frais, caillé et ses dérivés : crèmes…)au comptant et en détail dans la ville de Fana. 
Elles comptent réaliser  15 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of women, all married, who average 24 years of age and two children. They live in extended traditional families with their co-wives, brothers, sisters, and children in the village of Yolla (Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region) in the Republic of Mali. They know one another by community ties.

Intending to be able to buy a lot of milk and to serve their customers better, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their tenth loan, and all the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, the women want to buy 500 liters of milk from livestock farmers of Yolla and surrounding areas for retail sale (fresh milk, curdled milk, and milk products, such as cream). Sales are made in Fana at the retail level and in cash.

The group members plan to realize a profit of 15,000 francs CFA to help their husbands cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Falilat Ligani

texts.en: Falilat sells food. Falilat is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Falilat has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years and the loan has allowed her to tremendously increase her business. In order to further increase her business, she is requesting a $550 (50,000 NGN) loan to purchase more food to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy more food to sell

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji I. is seventy years old. He is married and has three children, two males and a female. According to him, all his children are married and living independently with their spouses. His wife is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in their community in the mornings.

Alhaji I. lives with his wife in a house built by his own toil in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Alhaji runs a provision store in which he sells products such as sugar, milk, "milo" (a cocoa beverage), toffees, etc. He says he buys his goods from Nkawkaw, a nearby city. His shop is by the roadside in his community. Alhaji has been in business for over fifteen years and is well experienced. He wants a loan to procure various provisions to stock his shop. He aspires to give his grandchildren the needed support that he can give them.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Hasie

texts.en:
Hasie M. is 32 years old. She is married with two children. One is currently in basic school and the other has yet to start school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Hasie works to support her husband financially. She is a trader of cosmetics. Hasie procures cosmetics such as body sprays, powder, creams, etc. and hawks to sell in the community where she lives. Hasie also treks to other markets to sell on their market days.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure varieties of cosmetics in bulk. She is hopeful to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: Procure cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Vaeluaga

texts.en:
Vaeluaga A., 31, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the general public seven days per week.

She has had one previous loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166). SPBD loans are Vaeluaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase canoe, torch, and fishing tools such as goggles, spear and a fishing net

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
“Everything happens for a reason,” says Lorna, who is 44 years old. She became a widow at the early age of 29, when her first husband passed away. They had 3 children: Ronaldo who is 27 years old, Roxan who is 25 years old, and Rafael, 23 years old, who is a Hotel and Restaurant Management college student in Manila. Five years after her husband’s death, she met Jesus V. and they married. Unfortunately, they never had chance to have children of their own. 

Lorna V. has been managing an eatery business for nearly five years, situated in front of the ISU (Isabela State University) of Angadanan campus. Her weekly net income is about PHP1,000. She is hoping to borrow loan from ASKI in the amount of PHP3,000 for assistance in her eatery business.

loans.use: Business Assistance - eatery.

loans.name: Mamour

texts.fr: mamour H. est né le 23 février 1976 à hanéne;il est marié et est père d'un enfant ;il travaille comme chauffeur livreur dans une boulangerie depuis 11 ans et vend aussi du pain au lait;avec ce pret il veut renforcer son activité et améliorer ses revenus;
texts.en:
Mamour H. was born on February 23, 1976 in Hanéne. He is married and the father of a child. He has been working as a delivery driver with a bakery for eleven years, and he also sells bread with milk. With this loan, he wants to bolster his business and to improve his revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell bread

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella S. is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters who are all still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She is forty years old, married, and lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic.

Stella is a trader, trading in crates of eggs. She buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farms and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy eggs in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy eggs in bulk

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора Джураева  1973 года рождения, замужем имеет 1 ребенка. Имеет среднее образование.  Занимается торговлей женской одеждой . Торгует на рынке более 5 лет.  
Раньше торговала на рынке города на улице.  После получения  очередного кредита  арендовала помещение на новом рынке «Сомон».  У нее расширился  оборот и клиентов больше чем на улице. 
От полученной прибыли она увеличила свой капитал. Что позволит ей расширить бизнес.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Gulnora D. is married and has 1 child. She has a secondary education. Gulnora sells women’s clothing. She has been selling at the market for over 5 years. Previously, she used to sell on the street at the city market. After obtaining a loan, she leased a space at the new Somon market. Her turnover increased, and she now has more clients than she had on the street. She used the resulting profit to increase her capital. This will help her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer goods

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Ismael López  de 51 años de edad, es integrante del grupo “Nueva Esperanza” y tiene el negocio de elaboración de muebles (bancos, sillas, mesas, cómodas, estantes), se unió al grupo hace un año y necesita el préstamo para  comprar  madera, él espera seguir con el grupo hasta obtener un crédito mayor. Al igual que Ismael las demás integrantes del grupo cuentan con diferentes negocios como la venta de zapatos, comida, otras se dedican a la confección de mantas, chamarras y algunas cuentan con tienda de barrio y necesitan el crédito para la comprar  mercadería (zapatos, arroz, fideo) y compra de materia prima (tela, lana y forro). A todas las integrantes de “Nueva Esperanza” les gusta confraternizar así que todas se preparan par compartir un apthapi (cada persona prepara comida y trae para compartir con el grupo).
texts.en:
Ismael López, 51, is a member of the Nueva Esperanza group. He makes furniture (benches, chairs, tables, dressers, shelves). He joined the group a year ago. He needs a loan to buy wood. He hopes to continue with the group and even get a larger loan. Just like Ismael, the rest of the group members have different businesses like selling shoes, food and other things. Some make blankets and jackets. Some have neighborhood stores. They need a loan to buy merchandise (shoes, rice, noodles) and to buy raw material (fabric, wool, and lining). All of the members of Nueva Esperanza like to get together with each other. They share potluck meals together.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material (wood, fabric, wool, and lining) and merchandise (shoes, rice, noodles)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a mother of four children. She is forty-five years old and married. Comfort works hard with the motivation of supporting her children’s education and providing them with a quality of life.

She sells corn dough and Gari. Corn dough is milled maize grain mixed with water and it is used to prepare local meals like banku and porridge. Gari is a cereal made from cassava.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to increase her production of corn dough and improve her income to support her kids' education and her household.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo las solidarias, han trabajado durante 7 años atras,en la compra y venta de ropa tipica usada y nueva para sostenimiento de sus familia y de ellas misma, ya que en este tiempo es dura la vida pero ellas tienen la certeza de seguir creciendo y luchando para sacar avante a sus hijos y poder salir avante vendiendo sus productos en otras areas, Por lo que se han acercado a la Asociaciòn  ASDIR para apoyarlas en el capital que ellas necesitan ya que en el lugar donde se hubican es de extrema pobreza, pero con la yuda ellas venderan màs por tener màs surtido sus mecaderia y tener mejores condiones de vida.

loans.use: aplicaciòn de capital

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Bancomunal un Nuevo Día, es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos de 19, 17, 15, 13 y 10 años. El mayor trabaja y los otros están en la escuela. 
Desde hace 5 años Hilda tiene su negocio de venta de  tejidos a mano como  chompas, ropa y zapatos. Ella compra la ropa en Lima y la lleva a la provincia. 
Hilda ha tenido mala suerte este año: en febrero una parte de su casa  se incendió  y robaron su préstamo anterior. Felizmente ella tenía sus ahorros para poder afrentar estas situaciones. 
Desde que comenzó en Finca Hilda ha podido aumentar su negocio y capital de trabajo.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles para comprar su mercadería, lanas y ropa. 
Hilda sueña con poner un puesto de ropa en su casa.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the New Day (Nuevo Día) Community Bank. She lives with her partner, is 36 years old, and has 5 children, who are 19, 17, 15, 13, and 10 years old. The oldest works and the others are in school. For 5 years, Hilda has had a business selling knitted goods, like sweaters, clothes and shoes. She buys the clothes in Lima and takes them to her province. Hilda has had bad luck this year; in February, part of her house burned down and her previous loan was stolen. Luckily, she has some savings so that she can face these situations. Since she began working with Finca, Hilda has been able to grow her business and capital. Hilda needs a loan for 1400 soles to buy merchandise, wool and clothes. Hilda dreams of having a clothing stand in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, wool and clothes

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon D. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 38 years old. Corazon is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Corazon is just starting this business.

In 2006, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Corazon from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero D. Agosto” D. distrito D. Zepita, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 58 años D. edad, estado civil casada, tiene 08 hijos, vive en la Comunidad D. Huilacaya, ella estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado menor para engorD..

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado menor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies for clothing

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 33 years old and a very assiduous businesswoman. She is married to Joselito, who is engaged in the trucking business. They have two children: Crisanto, a first year high school student, and Joan, a grade five student. Their family lives happily and peacefully in the village of Sitio Guingab, Tumauini, Isabela.

Merlita has been engaged in the poultry business for years. Aside from this, she is also engaged in a soap-vending business that she purchased in Bulacan. From these businesses, the income she generates is just enough to meet the daily needs of their family.

Merlita would like to borrow PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase additional chicks to raise and also soap to increase her income. The loan will benefit a lot, not only her business but also their family.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and soap

loans.name: Rowena's Group

texts.en:
Rowena D. R. is a woman with the bravery and strength of mind to rise above poverty. She is 33 years old and the mother of two, both males; one is in high school and one is in grade school.  She lives in the active town of Tanay, in the Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Ariel, who is 38 years old and a driver.

Rowena came to her mind of joining ASHI for the dreams and a bridge to support her in her business.  She needed to work and look for a living to support the needs of her children because the business became the main source of income and she receives good income for their future savings in case of emergency. She also earns extra income from her pedicure and manicure business. In 2006; she decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her membership in ASHI, she was noted for her excellent performance in terms of responding to her responsibilities in the organization.

Now Rowena is requesting a loan of Php20,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for  perfumes, towels, underwear for men and women, blouses, jeans, t-shirts, shoes, bags, slippers, and many others similar items. She has regular customers and she also receives and accepts orders.

Rowena hopes to send her children to school until they finish college and find the finest jobs. She also hopes to expand her business and be able to have more stock. She also dreams of having her own AVON Dealer outlet and to have own house and lot.  She even aspires to having a space in the market.

loans.use: To purchase Avon products to grow her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 54 años, es natural de la ciudad de Ancash (sierra central). Ella vive con sus 2 hijos;  Robert de 11 y Mirella de 16, ya que su esposo falleció hace algunos años.
Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar, incursionando en variedad de oficios, pero lo que más cómodo y rentable le resultó es la venta de verduras. Y esta actividad la realiza desde hace ya 20 años, tiempo en el que ha ganado experiencia en el comercio y ahora obtiene buenas ganancias, pues Juana tiene mucha empatía con sus clientes y es por eso que se ha convertido en el puesto más concurrido del mercado.
El gran sueño de Juana es agrandar su negocio y poder abrir otro local, así sus clientas se llevarían no solo las mejores verduras, si no también, la mejor atención que se merecen.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y hasta el momento demuestra ser muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita implementará su negocio con más verduras.
texts.en:
Juana, 54, is from the city of Ancash (central mountain range). She lives with her two children. Robert is 11, and Mirella is 16. Her husband died some years ago. She has worked at various jobs since she was very young. The most comfortable and profitable turned out to be selling vegetables. She has been doing this for 20 years. In that time she has gained experience in the business. Now she gets good earnings. Juana has a lot of empathy for her customers, and that is why her stand is the most popular one in the market. Juana’s big dream is to make her business bigger and to be able to open another location. That way her customers will not only get the best vegetables, but they will also get the best attention that they deserve. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She has shown herself to be very responsible. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more vegetables for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan D. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest daughter is 26 years old and stays at home with his family, and his youngest daughter is 8 years old and goes to a local secondary school.

Jargalsaihan sells second-hand shoes imported from abroad at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. He runs his shoe retail business with the help of his wife. He has been selling second-hand cheap shoes since 2000, and the business has been the main source of income for the family.

He says that he is quite experienced in the business and would like to continue to expand. His dream is to build a small cozy house for his family to live happily. He is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes

loans.name: Ibrokhim

texts.ru: Кулаев Иброхим проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Кулаев Иброхим работает в области торговли более чем 5 лет. Он имеет среднее образование. Кулаев Иброхим покупает продукты и продает. Кредит берет для закупа продуктовых товаров, т.е. для товараоборота.
texts.en:
K. Ibrokhim lives in the Yavan region. He's thirty-one years old, married, has three children and a high school education. He buys and sells foodstuffs: an enterprise he has been working at for more than five years. He is asking for a loan to buy new products and increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new products

loans.name: Los Cerros Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Cerros está integrado por Ana Clemencia A. de 47 años trabaja arduamente desde las 5:00am en que empiezan a llegar sus clientes a para hacer las compras del desayuno hasta la 9:00 pm.  Ella está contenta por como su negocio ha crecido y mejorado notablemente.
 
Sus compañeras de grupo son Yesica R.  de 38 años la cual comenzó vendiendo repochetas en su casa  y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta tener una fritanga y Martha R. de 29 años tiene un pequeño taller de costura desde hace siete años.
texts.en:
The "Los Cerros" (The Hills) Group consists of Ana Clemencia A., 47, who works arduously from 5 a.m., when her customers start arriving to buy their breakfasts, until 9 p.m. She is pleased because her business has grown and improved notably. Her fellow group members are Yesica R., 38, who started out selling snacks out of her home and little by little grew it until now she has a fried food stand; and Martha R., 29, who has had a small sewing shop for the past six years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, soap, detergent, meat, milk products, soft drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Enma

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío Sime, ubicado en el distrito de Pítipo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado durante más de 20 años a la crianza y comercialización de ovejas, empezó comprando ovejas para criarlas y poco a poco su cría aumentó. Actualmente vende sus animales a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y esta actividad no les provee de ingresos permamentes.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más ovejas, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer responsable, entregada a su familia y que gusta mucho de su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir ayudando a su familia para darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Sime, located in the district of Pitipo, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 20 years she has been raising and selling sheep. She began buying sheep to raise and little by little the brood grew. At present she sells her animals to businesspeople who visit the area regularly. This business really helps her family's finances since her husband works in farming and this activity does not provide permanent income. Rosa wants to grow her business with the purchase of more sheep, but she doesn't have enough capital to do this. This is why she sees the need, for the first time, to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to help her achieve her goal. She is a responsible woman, dedicated to her family and she really enjoys her job. Her biggest wish is to continue helping her family to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of sheep to grow her business.

loans.name: María Angelica

texts.es: María Angelica tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija que aún no estudia, ella vive en una comunidad cercana a la ciudad capital, que se llama Sumpango, Angelica vende comida todos los dias en el mercado municipal de Sumpango desde hace 17 años; ella solicita crédito, para poder arreglar su cocina en donde prepara la venta de comida. Tiene problemas con su cocina ya que en tiempo de lluvia el agua se cuela por las laminas, lo cual le crea dificultad para cocinar. También es dueña de un terreno que su padre le heredo en el cual siembra frijol. Su sueño es tener una cocina amplia para poder cocinar y con el dinero del crédito piensa comprar material para ampliar su cocina y comprar fertilizante para su siembra de frijol.
texts.en:
María Angelica, age 29, is married and has one daughter who isn’t yet in school. She lives in a community called Sumpango near the capital city. For 17 years Angelica has sold food in the municipal market of Sumpango. She is applying for the loan in order to repair the kitchen where she prepares the food she sells. She has problems with her kitchen because when it rains water leaks in, which makes it difficult to cook. With the money from the loan she wants to buy material for enlarging her kitchen and fertilizer for her bean crop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the enlargement of her kitchen

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru: Намозов Убайдулло проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Более 9 лет занимается растениеводством. Он берет в аренду землю, где выращивает овощи. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Ubaydullo N. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 43 years old, married and has 5 children. He has been involved in agriculture for over 9 years. Ubaydullo leases land, where he grows vegetables. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Renson

texts.en: Renson K. M. is 55 years old and has three children who go to school. He has been running a taxi business for four years.  Renson plans to buy another vehicle  to serve more customers.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Renson has been able to pay school fees for his children because he can access loans.  He has taken out three loans in the past from Faulu Kenya and he has successfully repaid them. Renson is determined to educate his children to university level. He has therefore requested a loan of kes 53,735 to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.es:
Arcenia tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen dos menores hijos. Vive en la hermosa selva cusqueña, en la localidad de Kimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa.

Empezó a trabajar desde muy jovencita, recuerda que ayudaba a sus padres en la chacra y se sentía cómoda con lo que hacía. Pero nunca imaginó que el curso de su vida iba a cambiar de manera repentina, pues actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Generalmente trabaja todos los días desde las 5:30 AM hasta las 9:00 PM y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos. No contento con ello, Arcenia anhela en un futuro cercano incursionar en la agricultura, cultivando cacao y café para tener ingresos extras.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pagos en las fechas estipuladas. También agradece a la institución por las facilidades de crédito que le están, otorgando. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de apalear las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arcenia is 31 years old. She lives with her partner and their two minor children. They live in the beautiful forest lands near Cusco, in the village of Kimbiri, where they have their own home. Arcenia started working when she was very young. She remembers that she helped her parents in the fields, and she was satisfied with what she did. But she never imagined that the course of her life would drastically change: she currently operates a grocery store. She usually works every day, from 5:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., and sometimes she receives help from her husband and children. Not content with this alone, Arcenia wants to start farming in the near future, cultivating cocoa and coffee to produce extra income. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on the specified dates. She also thanks the institution for the credit terms it is providing to her. With the funds she is requesting, she will buy more products for her grocery store, in order to satisfy her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying additional merchandise

loans.name: Eunelyn

texts.en:
Eunelyn M. is from the village of Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 21 years old and still single. To make a living, Eunelyn owns & operates a general store, and this is her main source of income. Eunelyn has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eunelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eunelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eunelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Eunelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus tradiciones y costumbres afro – peruanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves como patos, gallinas y también cría cuyes en unos corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Todos los martes viaja hacia una feria ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí para vender sus animales, esta feria es muy frecuentada por personas de la costa y sierra de la zona por lo que la demanda por sus animales siempre es abundante.

Margarita distribuye su tiempo entre las labores propias del hogar y la crianza de sus animales, ella desea brindarles a sus animales una alimentación balanceada de modo que su calidad mejore y pueda percibir mas ganancias al momento de venderlos. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de1000 nuevos soles.

Margarita es una mujer bastante responsable y que siempre ve la manera de apoyar a su esposo para salir juntos adelante. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen bastante cariño y estima.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their children in the Zaña district, an area known at the regional level for its traditions and its Afro-Peruvian customs. It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 2 years she has been raising and selling animals. She raises birds such as ducks and hens and she also raises guinea pigs in a pen that is installed behind her home. Each Tuesday she travels to a market located in the Cayaltí district to sell her animals. This market is very popular with people from the coast and the highlands in the area, so the demand for her animals is always high. Margarita divides her time between her household tasks and raising her animals. She wants to provide her animals with nutritious feed so that the quality of her animals will be better and she can earn more money when she sells them. For this reason she has requested for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Margarita is a very responsible woman who always finds a way to support her husband so that they can get ahead together. In the area where they live her neighbors and acquaintances have a lot of affection and esteem for her.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed to improve the quality of animals raised for sale

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyen Thị H. (20211020037) is a 45 year-old woman living in the town of Huyen Yen Phong - tỉnh Bac Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngo Noi nhom 08 (Nhom 08).

H. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing food services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new L. of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & used as working capital.  The L. will be the 1st L. taken out by Hoat from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nghiem Thị S. (0) is a 47 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyen Thị K. (0) is a 46 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the services sector providing recycling services.

3.  Nguyen Thị L. (0) is a 39 year-oldwoman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Nguyen Thị H. (0) is a 34 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SERIGNE BARRA est créé en 2007, il a 3 ans d'existence, il est composé de 08 femmes issues du même village. Elles sont âgées entre 30 et 60 ans, mariées et mères d'au moins 3  enfants. Les membres du groupe ont longtemps travailler ensemble,depuis plus de 05 ans et elles sont pratiquement de la même concession. Elles ont eu à développer beaucoup d'activités à savoir les tontines (crédit de petits montants rotatifs) des rencontres d'information et de sensibilisation, etc. L'activité dominante du groupe est le commerce de céréales locales et l'embouche bovine et ovine. Leur nouveau prêt les aidera à mieux développer ces activités en augmentant les quantités d'approvisionnement en marchandises et à améliorer les conditions de l'embouche.

Madame Amy G., debout à l'extrême droit de la photo est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique au marché de Diourbel, sa capitale régionale. Son prêt est destiné à augmenter la quantité de marchandises de sa boutique composées de riz, d'huile végétale, de sucre, des différentes boîtes de concertes etc. l'objectif de son crédit est de réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de couvrir les besoins scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SERIGNE BARRA was created in 2007 and has been in existence for three years.  It is composed of eight women from the same village.  The women range in age from 30 to 60, and they are married mothers of at least 3 children.  The group members have worked together for a long time, for over five years.  They have practically the same concession.  They have had to develop many activities, namely tontines (small rotating loans), information meetings, awareness meetings, etc.  The main business of the group involves commerce in local grains and the fattening of cattle and sheep. Their new loan will help them to develop these businesses further by increase the quantity of supplies of merchandise and by improving the conditions for their livestock. Ms. Amy G. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the head of the solidarity group.  She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children to support.  She has a shop at the market of Diourbel, the regional capital.  Her loan is for increasing the quantity of merchandise in her shop:  rice, vegetable oil, sugar, different canned foods, etc.  The goal of her loan is to make a profit, which will enable her to meet the schooling and health care needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing the businesses of the solidarity group
